description:
Love this place! Quick in and out. The owner/manager is very friendly and always smiling. 
The food is fresh and very tasty and not ridiculously expensive. 
My favorite is the Poke and Poke bowl, always so tasty.
I highly recommend this place for a quick take out lunch spot.
author: Margie R.

description:
Don't sleep on this place. The outside is nothing to look at but the portions are generous, the fish fresh, and the staff is efficient and friendly. 

The line can look pretty long, but it goes pretty fast. If you come 30 mins before noon or even after, the line dies down. There isn't any real seating inside so this place is more of a carry out joint. 

They have a newer updated menu with a few additions than online. I ordered their Deluxe bowl with brown rice. The box doesn't look like much, but when you pick it up, it definitely has some weight to it. The cuts are really decent and fresh. Your meal also comes with a small cup of miso soup and a baggie of edamame.
author: Junella T.

description:
I tried Sushi Taka through Meal Pal and I'm happy that I did. Their unagi bowl is really yummy and the flavors are really bright. I think the Meal Pal version is different from the dish on their regular menu, but I have no complaints. The bowl comes with unagi, roe, seaweed salad, corn, imitation crab, and sushi rice. 

The restaurant is small and really only a storefront, so there is usually a line out the door, which means go early! I'm looking forward to trying other items on their menu.
author: Lori C.

description:
I was hoping last year's photo on Yelp illustrating the line out the door surely wasn't the case any more, but I was wrong. Thankfully I caught the early beginning of the lunch rush. When it comes to long lines, there are two possibilities: it's overhyped because of some IG-worthy item or it's actually good. I'm relieved to say it's the latter (no disrespect to the IG users out there, I love me some snazzy food pics!)

The folks at this joint are experienced at handling hungry hippos like myself. I ordered and got my food in a timely manner - points for competence and efficiency! Daily special ran me $10 flat and when I checked in on Yelp, I got myself free miso soup and edamame - apparently these items aren't included in a daily special but are in the regular menu. If you punch in your number, you get a digital stamp card so that's an extra perk for you frequent diners out there. 

Quality of fish was fresh and tasty, minus one piece that was a teensy but fishy. The daily special had salmon and spicy tuna poke with crab salad, seaweed salad, and corn on brown rice. The poke was actual marinated fish, seasoned and all, the way it's supposed to be made. The portion appeared small at first, but I found myself struggling to finish it 3/4 of the way in and I'm a fatkid who usually devours all my food! In conclusion, if you're looking for fast, affordable, and tasty eats, this is the place for you!
author: Jenny W.

description: I like to stop by this place after work often. They recently started closing later, and they give $1 off after worktime (I don't remember the exact time). I usually get the taka bowl. The fish is fresh, and the portion is pretty well-sized for the price. My only gripe is that the rice isn't always consistent, but I don't mind much.
author: Cynthia M.

description: The best sushi bowl I had thus far. Made my own with salmon poke, tofu and shrimp tempura. Flavors on spot and just perfect portion size including perfectly cooked brown rice. Miso soup with seaweed was not too salty which most places get wrong. And friendly staff to boot!
author: Kathy L.

description: I enjoyed grabbing lunch from this place through Ritual for quick no line pick up for good quality sushi until today.  I got the Delux bowl.  When I got back to the office, I couldn't get over the overpowering fish smell coming from my food.  The ikura was slimy and extremely fish, hamachi was awful shredded pieces and the rice was hard.  I ate some salmon poke tried little of everything then tossed the rest.  I am glad I didn't finish because in a couple of hours, I totally got sick.  I tried calling the number shown here to let them know but that number doesn't take calls.  Totally bummed that what I thought was a great sushi find went downhill.  I wonder that's why folks still just order when they get there to get freshly put together meals.  Either way, not worth risking it for me.  I am still not fully recovered from this lunch four hours later.
author: Nana K.

description: Ordered a delux bowl and it came with miso soup. The sashimi tasted very good and the amount is plentiful! Staff is very friendly, the line is long but fast as well. Recommend if you wanna grab something fresh for take out !
author: Veronica C.

description:
I walk by here all the time on my way to China town, but haven't tried this place til the other day when a friend brought me! I came by around 2pm on Friday and just missed the crowd, however they only had white rice and were low on other items as well. 

I got the Salmon bowl and they really pack the bowls! There was a good amount of salmon and crab meat. Definitely worth the money. And the seaweed salad was surprisingly really delicious!

It's really neat they have a stamp card system for those frequent visitors. My friend got 10 stamps and $10 off his next order.
author: Meliza M.

description: The price was right and the sushi burrito was good.  I thought that there'd be seating, but it's only a take-out spot.  That was disappointing.  All in all everything was decent.  I tried to use my yelp offer but they were out of Edamame the day I was there.
author: Jeunesse S.

description:
On a journey to try new places around my work. It was a bit away, but that was okay.

Came 30 min before closing and all their best stuff is GONE. Definitely want to come when they open.

Tried their unagi and take bowl. Omgggggggg, so much love put inside I could cry. I'm not one to even like poke bowls! Glad I gave this spot a shot! Can't wait to come back and try other items.

Miso soup is complimentary. I found it salty and not really good.
author: Lynn C.

description: Quick and easy, very helpful people.  No place to sit down or sake.  This is a place to grab n go, nice big portions.  There is even gluten green soy sauce.  I recommend:)
author: Bruce P.

description: Is it possible to say NO to a rice plate with abundant of fresh salmon, spicy tuna, crab, and AVOCADO? NOOOO WAYY. Their rice plates are AWESOME! It is not expensive since you are getting a big portion! LOvE it!
author: Cristina W.

description:
Delicious food makes this place well worth a visit! Just do it! 

Great for quickly grabbing during work, or simply enjoying for dinner. The grilled unagi was fantastic and reminded me of being in Japan--that's not easy to find here. Absolutely get it, even if you've never tried it before. On top of it, service is what you'd expect: polite, extremely respectful, and above and beyond the average in SF.
author: Evan W.

description:
This place has been a great grab-and-go lunch spot. The portion size is great and they usually give you miso soup and edamame in addition. I usually stick with the Taka Bowl, consisting of salmon, spicy tuna, avocado, masago, seaweed salad, crab salad, etc. During lunch time, there's a moderate line, but they are really efficient and it moves fast. The burritos are also pretty interesting; I'm not a huge fan, but I'll get it once in a while.

Get ten meals and on your next one, save $10. The app once failed and a person took my name and number down to later apply the ten stamps to my account. I've also seen it happen a few weeks ago to another person. I wouldn't trust them to apply those points to your account, since when I stopped by again a few weeks later, I was still at zero and it was awkward...

MEALPAL comments:
Definitely one of my favorites on MealPal. Skip the line and just get your food. You won't get edamame and miso soup with MealPal though. The portion size is rather decent unlike most MealPal locations that exhibit a one-third reduction. I like going on Tuesdays for their Taka bowls - Taka Tuesdays!
author: James N.

description: Sushi Taka has so many tasty options. I think I come here about once a week (!!) with my coworkers to pick up lunch. I mainly get some version of the poke bowls, but I've also tried the cooked unagi bowl (which was good, but not my favourite). I prefer to take my lunch order to-go and eat it more comfortably in a park nearby or back at the office. However, they do have a small seating area outside if you need a place to stay. (I've only stayed to eat lunch there once, which was fine, but it was a busy street with lots of cars and people, so it wasn't very peaceful). Usually when I come to Sushi Taka during lunch rush hour, there's a line out the door and around the corner. Luckily, they participate in a lot of pickup (Postmates, Ritual, etc.) and delivery (Postmates, Grubhub, etc.) programs if you're more time constrained; I usually use pickup and don't need to wait in line, which is fab! Sushi Taka (despite it being a bit of a walk for me) is definitely one of my favourite lunch places, and I'm sure I'll be back soon for more :)
author: Bianca C.

description:
I've been a supporter of Sushi Taka ever since I started working in the area. Being just a short distance from work, it was an easy go-to. Not gonna lie-I was wrapped up in the whole sushi burrito thing for a while, lol. 

This place has expanded their menu, offering more than just the few choices of the sushi burritos and bowls from the previous menu. (It doesn't look like the entire menu is listed for the Order Pickup on here, so you will have to order there for the other options). They have newly-added bases for you to choose (white/brown rice, mixed greens, ramen salad). I've tried the Spicy Salmon Burrito, Shrimp Tempura Burrito, the Taka Bowl, Fire Bowl, and the Salmon Poke Bowl which are all fairly consistent in quality; the fish is always fresh and plentiful and the crab salad is flavorful.

The place is small, but more of a pick-up-your-food-type-of place. Though the line is often out the door, the service is quick- I am out the door shortly after ordering at the counter (in my experiences, at least). Solid sushi burrito/poke spot! It's been difficult to find another good poke spot in the area, but it's nice to know Taka is here to stay!
author: Meghan J.

description:
Working in financial district, Sushi Taka is quite a frequent lunch spot for us. I would say we get it probably once a week because it's that good! The line goes super quick and there aren't a ton of options to choose from so it becomes pretty easy to order.

Food: I always opt for the Salmon Poke Bowl with white rice. I absolutely love salmon poke and they do a good job of not over complicating their poke bowls. The majority of their bowls come with white/brown rice, seaweed salad, and crab with a some of the bowls mixing it up here and there. Unlike other poke bowls, there isn't much room for customization but sometimes simpler is better.Their salmon is already dressed in some sort of shoyu based sauce. The fish taste super fresh and I love the salmon flavor that comes out. A huge plus is that with every bowl you order, they give you a FREE miso soup and little packet of edamame. 

Tip: If you enjoy Sushi Taka as much as I do, be sure to input your phone number into their rewards system. For every 10 bowls you order, you will receive $10 off your next 11th bowl.
author: Eric L.

description:
I've tried Sushi Taka for lunch a couple of days ago. It is located on California & Kearny which is like the end of FiDi and start of Chinatown, so it ended up being quite a walk from my office. At the peak lunch hour there was a huge line almost 15 people deep which meant it was definitely popular. Unfortunately the line moved very slowly and it took almost 15 minutes for my turn to order. The menu here is rice bowls and sushi burritos. I decided to get the Fire Bowl ($9.66). The gentleman behind the counter asked if I wanted miso soup and not knowing that it comes free with the Fire Bowl, I declined. 

As per the menu the Fire bowl consists of fresh Salmon, spicy Tuna, spicy tobiko, egg crepe, mixed greens, seaweed Salad and spicy mayo. What I got contained all elements. It also tasted good. Everything seemed to be fresh and even the rice was of a decent quality. As I liked what I got I came back after a couple of days. After enduring the same long slow moving line, this time I decided to get the Taka Bowl ($10.58) which as per the menu consists of salmon poke, spicy tuna, crab salad, spicy tobiko, egg crepe, avocado, mixed greens and seaweed salad. This time I said yes I do want miso soup and got a small container with miso soup along with my Taka Bowl. The Taka Bowl was also good. The only thing that I didn't like was the imitation crab salad so I'd drop that the next time, but that is more of a personal choice. The hot miso soup was average but a welcome addition for a cold day.

Price wise most of their items are below the $12 mark which is considered good for the area. Quality is also good for the price. Service is slow. They need to speed up as standing outside in the cold is not fun and they should simply provide the miso soup to everyone rather than ask each person individually. Overall there are some rough edges but this is a solid place to get a decent sushi bowl at a reasonable price in FiDi.
author: Ahmad J.

description:
Picking up my MealPal...
"What's your number?"
"1908"
"Here you go" *looks to my friend* "And you, what's your number?"
"Oh no, she doesn't have MealPal"
"I know, I'm asking for her number"
THIS GUY IS THE BEST! He's all smiles every time I visit. Best response ever!

Pros:
+ Decent ingredients
+ Friendly service
+ A table or two outside
+ Food is always ready for MealPal
+ Generous portions for MealPal

Cons:
- Rice can be a bit stiff

Recommendations:
+ Ahi Poke Bowl (tuna)
+ Taka Bowl (salmon + spicy tuna)
+ Salmon Bowl (salmon)

A solid 3.5 in terms of food quality. The food isn't bad, the price is right, and the service is good. I'm not an imitation crab or spicy tuna fan, but I'll eat it since it's in my bowl. It's not the best, but my tastebuds were not offended, so Sushi Taka is doing pretty good.

Yes, the rice bothers me. But for $7 through MealPal, I ain't complainin'. The fish is good, and that's what matters the most. Will be back!
author: Fanny W.

description:
Good lunch option in the fidi! I ordered the salmon poke bowl with brown rice. The line looks long but they are super efficient so it moves quickly! Each order comes with miso soup and edamame. The salmon was good quality, buttery and fresh! I enjoyed the masago, tamago, and seaweed salad as well. I just wish there was more sauce in the bowl because the only part that had sauce mixed in was the salmon, and it only covered part of the rice.

The sushi burritos look yummy too!
author: Tara A.

description:
Good sushi, inexpensive, & fast.  Perfect for a quick stop-by if you are in the area.

The Chirashi Bowl is nice (I ordered mine without corn).  

It gets crowded and very limited seating, so most of the time you'll want to take your food to the nearby park.
author: Jason B.

description:
Wow. That's some fresh salmon.

The salmon poke bowl had super moist, buttery salmon. Could not stop eating it. It was seasoned in soy sauce so the fish taste wasn't quite there but hey, quality fish. The only qualm I had was that the very middle of the fish was still slightly frozen. At first glance, the portion looked on the smaller side, but was actually pretty decent for $11.50. The egg was actually layered and pretty good. Felt like the imitation crab salad took up a bit more of the bowl than I'd have liked and was really salty. Seaweed salad was more sour than I've had...think it may have been on its way to being bad :(. Still though. SALMON. 4.5/5.

The unagi bowl was a bit more standard. The same amount of fish (or even a bit more) than what your average sushi restaurant would give you for ~$5 less in price ($11.50 here vs. $16+ at most spots). Unagi wasn't bad but I like it more smoky. 3.5/5.

I've had a couple of the other items since-- spicy tuna is pretty standard, the scallops they had were also tasty. I wish they were open on the weekends, but when everything else is closed, I suppose that only makes sense. 

Sushi Taka, what did we do to deserve you here?
--

Edit: I stopped back in and the employee behind the counter, Bert, provided some awesome customer service and threw in some extra edamame since it was a slow day. Really appreciate it, Sushi Taka!
author: Nicole H.

description:
Great little spot for lunch - takeout only. I got the Taka salad bowl. Fresh fish. Free miso soup. Quick service. Perfect for financial district worker who just need to grab something quick for lunch for takeout.

the only thing I dislike is that the imitation crab portion has mayonnaise and isn't my favorite component that goes with the bowls.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
I've picked up lunch here a few times and food is consistent.  It's reliable and the biggest draw for me is the location because I'm less than a block away.  

I have had most thing here -- sushi burritos and bowls.  I had the Fire bowl today with brown rice.  Where did the egg go?  No mixed greens?  I still enjoyed it though.  All that protein is very filling.  It can be a lot of rice so you can ask for less or just not eat it.  It has salmon pieces, spicy tuna, seaweed salad and pickled carrots with spicy mayo.  I need to remember to ask them to hold the spicy mayo next time.

I signed up for their loyalty program so they send me coupons regularly.  I used a $2 coupon today.  It's all tied to a phone number so it's easy to track and redeem.

Everyone is offered free miso soup and edamame.  No extra fee for that.  But they ran out of edamame at 1:10 when I was there today.

Seems that they buy everything processed (spicy tuna out of a tub?), pickled carrots in huge bags??  I could be totally off but it don't look made onsite.
author: Susan C.

description:
I got take out from this place though MealPal. It's pretty cool since you get to skip the line and just grab your lunch. That day, they had a spicy tuna rice bowl. I was actually surprised by how good this was. The spicy tuna was really good and well flavored. It also came with some imitation crab meat and some seaweed salad which was good too. I also liked the sticky rice. 

Overall, it was a really good and filling meal and I would come back for another one.
author: Sophia Y.

description: This food is always fresh and as ordered. I have gone other places for sushi bowls and always regret not going to Sushi Taka! Order ahead on Yelp and avoid the line.
author: Megan S.

description:
This place deserves all of its business and more.

I've been coming in here for years and the owner has always been so nice!

The prices are ridiculously fair for what you get.

He used to make sushi burritos but pivoted to poke bowls, which was a smart move. He still has sushi burritos on the menu but the bowls are just as good.

I like the poke on poke bowl. everything is delicious, you get a free soup with purchase, and it's quick.

Love this place!
author: T L.

description:
Decided to check this place out because of the long lines I always see. 

Came here for lunch around 12:00 and there wasn't a line yet. I got a taka bowl with no tamago or seaweed because I don't like either. Cool that they give you complimentary miso soup and edamame. The taka bowl was pretty bland and nothing was too special about it. Not sure on the hype here. If I come back I may try one of the rolls instead.
author: Hayley D.

description:
I tried the Taka Bowl and the Unagi Bowl. Brown rice instead of white rice was free, which was nice. 

The Taka Bowl seemed to have a pretty good variety of toppings: Salmon, spicy tuna, imitation crab, avocado, seaweed salad, and tamago. Good variety of toppings but...not very much of each topping. Or the rice for that matter. The photos are pretty deceiving. At the least, I think they could at least fill the bowl container with more rice, which would make the bowl more filling without being a big cost to them.

Unagi Bowl tasted good, but it was even smaller than the Taka Bowl. Again, I get that unagi can be expensive, but I barely had any rice with each bite. 

Overall, a good lunch spot, but not the greatest value in my opinion, at least for the bowls. Maybe the rolls are better value. As a side note, I find it funny that their Yelp check-in offer is free miso soup and edamame, but you already get it with any bowls and rolls LOL.
author: Sara L.

description:
Great lunch place close to financial district. 

Quick service - came here around lunchtime and was in and out in about 15 minutes. There's not a lot of places to sit so you have to take to go. 

I ordered the Chirasi bowl, which had a little bit of everything for $18. Fish was solid but not mindblowing. Other coworkers got different bowls which were priced from $12-15. The cucumber noodles looked good and would come back to try them. 

You need to ask for the wasabi. If you check in on Yelp they'll provide some soup and edamame! 

Overall solid place for a quick lunch - don't come here expecting plus service and you will leave happy.
author: Kevin Y.

description:
I tried this place for meal pal (well I ate my boyfriend's meal pal to be exact :D)

My boyfriend ordered the Salmon poke bowl and portions were pretty big! It had rice underneath and came with some seaweed salad as well as some chipolte creamy sauce and wasabi creamy sauce. This is a very popular item on meal pal, I heard it gets sold out within seconds and I do believe it because it darn worth it and good!

I would definitely come back and try their other items!
author: Natalie L.

description:
I love heading here for my sushi burrito fix for a couple of reasons:

For one, Sushi Taka is all about offering a variety of quality fish ingredients and playing that up. This is much different than what I'm used to having at Sushirritto in the FiDi, where it's more about just slathering everything in funky sauces with cool names. That freshness combined with decent prices and free extras is a formula for instant approval in my book of noms! 

The extras I'm talking about include miso soup and edamame, but note that they tend to run out. That tip was from the the cashier, so points to him for keeping it real and setting honest expectations. Even more points to this place because I've never dealt with that problem. To get the best bang for your buck, I recommend heading here earlier in the day to make sure you get those free extras! 

All in all, this is a solid sushi burrito spot for any non-sushi snob, looking to try sushi in a funky, new form!
author: Stephen D.

description:
Wow!  What a deal and what a meal.  No wonder the line went all the way to the corner.  I will probably come here whenever.

I got the Hamachi bowl. The fish was fresh, the flavor just right.  The crab-meat salad was an extra credit.  The rice was near perfect. A bit seaweed on the side.  All for $12.

I don't really believe that a blue-fin tuna bowl can be had for $15.  So I did not try.
author: Sin-Yaw W.

description: Great food, the poke bowl is tasty. Long line during lunch time. I think the only option is to-go cuz they don't have a ding Area. Nice location, near Chinatown and financial district. Nice people there too.
author: Wandi C.

description: This place is awesome! You know when you go to a restaurant and the ppl working there really WANT to feed you?! I ordered a cucumber hand roll for each of my kids $4.. they were huge! And came with a hot soup. We ended up only eating one roll and have a hot meal to someone that needed more than us! #rainydaysinsanfrancisco
author: Nechama B.

description:
This is a local joint featuring sushi to go.

Think of it like upscale supermarket sushi since they'll make it for you there, though most of it is already prepared.

If you're close to this place, for example if you work downtown it's convienent but very average.

What cracks me up is that they always run out of miso soup, and it's like a powdered miso soup so I'm not sure what the hype is about.

But, some of my coworkers love it for the convienence and because they're craving sushi.
author: Jack R.

description: I got the shrimp tempura bowl and I really enjoyed it. The flavours were delicious together. It came with shrimp tempura, sushi mayo, teriyaki sauce, crab, wakame, edamame, corn and some fried bits on top. I'm not sure what it was but it added to the texture of the dish. I also added avocado. The sushi rice was just the right seasoning and I found it really filling. I didn't even use and soya sauce. It's a good place to grab and go as there really isn't any seating so just bear that in mind. The service was quick and the owner was very friendly.
author: Grace T.

description:
Best fish-to-price ratio in SF!

Consistently quality, fresh ingredients and options for $10-16 for a bowl of salmon/tuna/everything sushi w/ rice, seaweed salad, carrots, etc. + free miso soup! Doesn't offer as many crazy toppings as Poke places but honestly when you have large chunks of fresh fish, you wouldn't need all that extra stuff! 

The storefront is very unassuming and they have no tables to sit down but honestly this is the best place for a sushi lunch. 

Initially discovered this place through Postmates... what?! This place is just too underrated and I'm glad! I have to walk nearly a mile to come here (always worked in/around the Ferry Building) but perhaps that is good, since it prevents me from spending all my $$ here! :)
author: Mingmei N.

description:
This place is pricey, like most lunch spots in the fi-di. I usually get it through a meal app which helps cut the cost, but you definitely don't get the same meal going that route. For example, the Taka bowl through MealPal has less fish, no avocado and more filler like carrots or slaw. I do have to say that the quality of the fish is better than other options in the area.

If you do go at lunch time, go early or really late. During peak time the line will be quite long.
author: Melissa H.

description:
I see ads for Sushi Taka all the time for their 'sushiritto' type rolls.

I decided to try this place for as a new lunch spot and saw that they also do rice bowls.
There is only 1 vegetarian option-Tofu Teriyaki bowl.
Order without the mayo & egg-based sauce and it is vegan-friendly.

Choose brown or white rice, and it is topped with tofu, seaweed, pickled veggies, and teriyaki sauce.
They also include a free side of steamed edamame & miso soup with every order. However, the miso soup has fish in it, so I passed on that.

Overall the bowl is decent, didn't taste bad, but nothing exciting or special about it either.

For less than $10, it's a good price for being in the fidi!
author: Lanie L.

description:
Love Sushi Taka and the people that run it. Such pleasant friendly people and always willing and able to cater to adjustments. I generally always get the fire bowl and swap the rice out for mixed greens. Great size, good quality ingredients, and made super fast.

I have tried their salmon poke burrito many times as well and it beats the pants off the 'original' burrito guys down the road at Sushiritto, and cheaper to boot. 

Icing on the cake here is the free miso soup and edamame as well. A great little accompaniment for their food.

They have a loyalty scheme too which is great - come 10 times and save $10.
author: David J.

description: Been coming here every so often for their Mealpal item and it's a solid performer.  I'm not a sushi expert, but it is up to my standards and a nice variety of items in their bowls.  Mainly had the salmon poke.
author: Marc S.

description:
The service is indeed fast for its small space and menu variety. I got a spicy tuna bowl and there was a lot more rice and sides than fish, which tasted a little off as well. It's definitely a lunch option, just not on a must-go-to level for me. I'd come back to try out the rest of their menu, though.
The miso soup and edamame check-in offer is nice, though they gave me 5-6 pods to stretch out how fast they run out of them.
author: Amy H.

description: I ordered a salmon burrito. The fish is very fresh.  The ingredients of the sushi burrito just got updated. So the taste is very rich. As a bonus, it comes with miso soup and edamame. The staff are very friendly and the place is clean. Highly recommended.
author: Donna M.

description:
I really wanted to like Sushi Taka. The staff is always nice. They have a long line during lunch but they've sped up the process. While you wait in line, someone will ask you (if you're close to the door) what you would like to order. By the time you get to the front to pay, your order will be ready. Efficient! Every order also comes with a small miso soup and edamame.

I've come here a few times for their Shrimp tempura burrito. Always given fresh ingredients. Portion size is a bit small. Flavor is a bit lacking. I was hoping for some mayo/sauce for the crab meat. I would probably stick to Sushirrito.
author: Benita M.

description: Definitely love how they give you a complementary miso soup and a packet of edamame. The staff were all extremely nice and swiftly at preparing everyone's food. The food is really great and the customization option is always a bonus point. Although the combination of the separate elements of a certain choice isn't the most coherent, it's all super delicious.
author: Alina Y.

description:
I ordered the fire bowl which was.... good, but not great, in my opinion. I have really high standards for sushi and poke bowls, and this didn't really meet my expectations. 

However, the customer service here is amazing. The folks that work here are super friendly, quick, and efficient. Perfect for grabbing a quick lunch when you're in a rush!

The customer service alone is enough for me to return back. :)
author: Jaq I.

description:
I'm sitting here scratching my head trying to figure out what I used to like about this place. I have only ever gotten the spicy salmon burrito and today I grabbed one after about a 5 month hiatus from Sushi Taka. It was terrible. I remembered there being lemon in it, which was what I liked, and it appears to no longer be an ingredient in this item. Bummer. Also asked for extra jalapenos and I can barely taste any. The worst part is that there are entirely too many carrots (are they even pickled? I can't tell), and they overpower all the other flavors. Honestly considering throwing this one away and stepping out again to try something else-- somewhere else. 

It's too bad because I think I have about 7 stamps on my lunch card here and I probably won't ever be back. Sushirrito only from here on out.
author: Lisa L.

description:
Came here for the first time the food was so good. I got the unagi don and blue fin tuna-- both were hefty in portion and delicious.

The owner and staff were also very kind and made it an enjoyable experience
author: diane d.

description:
Very disappointed. Will not pick this restaurant from mealpal again.
Small portion (10 small pieces of salmon, a little crab meat, plus some sour smell  veggies, and of course lot of rice).
author: X G.

description:
In the fidi area, there's something like 4-5 places that serve some variation on poke bowl or sushi burrito. Sushirrito, Ohana, Bamboo Asia, Blue Hawaii, and Sushi Taka. While each restaurant brings something uniquely different, I find myself going back to Sushi Taka over and over again.

Sushi Taka wins on:

1. Variety: offering both sushi burritos and poor bowls. 
2. Flexibility. Sushi bowls can be made with a base of white rice, brown rice, or mixed greens. As long as the ingredient is in house, Sushi Taka will accommodate your customization
3.  Efficiency. Despite long lines pretty much every weekday lunch, Sushi Taka is able to move through people quickly. 
4. Value. While I wouldn't exactly call this place cheap, the pricing is better than the competitive set. 
5. Friendliness. Despite the hectic pace, staff is generally pretty friendly.
author: Judy C.

description: Good hospitality and very reasonable price. Although the store just for to go but its taste was so fresh and light. I always come here when i craving poke especially Taka poke bowl (spicy tuna , salmon, sweet eggs, avocado ) was so wonderful
author: Tiratiwan L.

description:
Had the Unagi Bowl through MealPal. I arrived at 12 and a line around the corner already, luckily I was able to go straight to the cashier.

My first time here and I really enjoyed it! The unagi was well seasoned - definitely will be back for their rolls!
author: Carrie L.

description:
I got the Spicy Tuna Bowl off Meal Pal and it is a 15-20 min walk from work. The flavor was tasty, but I feel that the bowl was a little empty. There is more rice then I like and more side things then tuna. It was more imitation crab then tuna. Additionally, I wish there was more then just a little seaweed salad and 2 small pieces of sweet egg omelette.

I wish for maybe so squid salad or Japanese pickles. My fried that ordered there seemed to get more fish, so maybe if the salmon bowl is on meal pal, I will order it.
author: Mei L.

description: This is the BEST SPOT IN SF FOR LUNCH POKE. The portions are generous, the fish is fresh enough, the service is insanely fast. No, it's not a high-end sushi spot, but it gets the job done. I wish they didn't close at 4pm so that I could grab some for dinner...
author: Annie A.

description: I have came back and tried the truffle salmon bowl through meal pal, I believe this item isn't on their menu though. I really enjoyed the crab salad, seaweed salad and egg crepe that it came with, but I didn't really enjoy the truffle salmon. The salmon did not taste very fresh and it was also very salty with the truffle flavor, in my opinion. Although the fire bowl or sushi taka bowl are some of the popular choices here, unfortunately, I do not think I will come back to try it. I'll just stick to sushiritto or ohana, across the street next time.
author: Bailey L.

description:
How have I not reviewed this place? I swear I've been here 100 times. Probably was just trying to keep this place a secret... Such great, quality sushi. And such a large portion. With friendly staff to boot!

When I first starting coming here this place was not nearly as popular. Now, I have to make it a point to get there before noon in order to avoid the long line that forms.
author: Amanda B.

description:
Please read my other review first!!

I still like this place and the service is top notch.  The guys that work there are really nice.  There is sometimes a really long line here and I don't understand it b/c they take the orders fast and they make the food fast.

One thing that was mildly annoying today was that my bowl seemed half empty.  They have really cut back on the rice.  I understand some people don't want a lot of rice and just view it as filler, but I really like their rice here.  They also used to offer extra rice for free back in the day and I wish they still had that option.

The fish is hit and miss, but it never horrible and hit probably about 80% of the time.

I still like this place and they still include miso and edamame with all orders and I will continue to come here, I'm just providing feedback.
author: Ty C.

description:
This place is such a little hole in the wall bht this is some of the best poke and customer service I've had.

LITERALLY 5 seconds in this Filipino man greeted me asking if I've been there before, introduced the work crew, the place and the food. He was throwing some jokes 10 seconds in and was very welcoming saying, "We wanna make you feel like family."

I immediately felt so welcome! I didn't know what I wanted but decided to try something new: their tofu noodles. I wasn't sure so I asked to sample and they gave me some.

Ended up getting the Tofu Noodle bowl with all salmon poke and spicy tuna. My god, I paid $12 for a generous portion that also came with a little soup and edamame.

They also have sushi burritos hot and cold. And other poke bowl combinations! I was seriously planning to go to Sushiritto but fate brought me here. My new go to!

SERIOUSLY cant stress enough how nice they are. They know all their customers, esp the frequent regulars and you feel more than a consumer, you really do feel like family.

I didn't get your name funny Filipino guy that works there but thank you for the service, laughs, food and conversation!
author: Dane O.

description: I had their Taka Bowl and it was very good though I wished the rice was much fluffier. It had a nice mix of crab, salmon, tuna, mixed greens, and seaweed salad. I enjoyed it a lot. The place always has a line and Friday at 1130am was no exception. I had a MealPass so I just had to find my name on their list and let them know.
author: Jen L.

description:
Fast, filling and cheap -- chicken teriyaki, brown rice with edamame and miso soup for ~$10

decently healthy but a bit on the sweet side. Line moves quickly and service friendly
author: Kristie C.

description:
Super fresh, super delicious, and super people.

Made a large group order (10 bowls) the day before and they were so great to work with! 

Everyone in my office argued over who won lunch because it was ALL great.
author: Kate N.

description:
If you MUST have a sushi-burrito, skip the expensive rolls and long lines at Sushirrito and go to Sushi Taka instead. Does anyone else find Sushirrito a little bland? Taka is friendly but lightning fast (I was in and out in 5 minutes), flexible on subbing out ingredients....most importantly, their sushi burrito is really flavorful and filling and comes with free miso soup and edamame. 

The salmon roll ($10) was filled with fresh salmon sashimi, and I liked the teriyaki sauce (subbed teri for wasabi mayo, subbed wasabi salmon for plain salmon). It also had a nice crunch with the tempura flakes and pickled radish. 

Would definitely return to try the unagi; the spicy tuna looked unappetizing to me. 

Like other sushi-burritos, this one falls apart and can be messy, but I still enjoyed it. Overall, go to Taka if you're looking for a cheaper, tastier version of Sushirrito.
author: Jess C.

description:
Been here the 3rd time within 2 weeks, and I always order the same thing, BBQ Beef Bowl. It's actually a Gyudon recipe where beef and onion are simmered in a mildly sweet sauce flavored with dashi, soy sauce and mirin. The bowl includes a side of pickled carrots, seaweed salad, slices of narutomaki (japanese fish cakes), and fried garlic in chilli oil garnish (love the fried garlic). If you come early, your order comes with a side of edamame and miso soup until it runs out. The flavor of the Beef Bowl is always consistent, and I don't have any weird lingering after-taste in my mouth, which I think is caused by preservatives. So I enjoy it very much!

The owner is Japanese, and when I see him, I noticed that he works with the staff in serving customers as well as training his staff to have good customer service practices. It shows that he's fully involved and strives to improve his business, which is a good trait to have as a business owner.  

I haven't had any of their raw fish menus just because I don't prefer raw fish for lunch during my work days, but I feel confident that they are good given there's always a long line here. This will be one of my go-to place, and I can't wait to complete my rewards card and get $10 discount after 10 stamps!
author: Summer O.

description:
I was pretty excited to come here since there were a lot of positive reviews but unfortunately, I'm pretty disappointed. First of all, I tried to go a little before the usual FiDi lunch rush, but there was still a line. Overall, it wasn't too bad since they were pretty efficient at moving people through but I think at the cost of qualify. Both me and my friend asked for a small change to our bowls and they messed that up even though it was something really simple (do not put roe on my bowl for example).

As for the food itself, the rice didn't see very fresh and tasted off. They also didn't add enough sauce and I had to ask specifically to get sauce. The fish itself was probably the best part of the dish. Given its portion sizes and what you get in the bowl though, it seems okay for FiDi prices but mostly because there aren't that many amazing poke options around here.

They also offer free edamame and miso soup (no need to check in) but that miso soup was pure salt. I couldn't even stomach a 2nd spoonful before of how insanely salty it was. Would definitely not recommend.
author: Cassie Z.

description:
I used to like Sushi Taka a lot (only getting the Taka Bowl) and would go fairly often since the winter of 2016. At the time, I'd say 5 stars. It was awesome!

I just picked up a taka bwol today after not going there for a few months. Maybe my expectations were too high? Maybe I somehow had a much rosier memory of what I got, but I felt pretty let down. I'm not a fan of the unsliced quarter of avocado and the carrots -- avocado is tricky to eat and didn't taste fresh; carrots are a weird flavor between sort of cooked and pickled. The seaweed salad also tasted stale. I wish the Sushi Taka of days gone would make a return!

Also, minor thing, but the round bowls used to be a nice touch. It was easy to mix up the ingredients and they looked cool.
author: Timur A.

description:
Great place for a quick lunch to go. Stopped by at 11:30am on a Monday and there was no wait. Great variety of sushi bowls and burritos. Comes with free miso soup and edamame.

Deluxe bowl 5/5: fish was tasty and fresh
author: Gary R.

description:
This used to be one of my favorite poke bowl spots. 

It seems like quality/ingredients have changed over the years. They used to have these little crunchy things, and egg. Now they have crab salad and pickled carrots (not a fan of either). And once or twice the fish was still slightly frozen. 

New fav spot is ramen bar for their salmon poke bowl.
author: sharon s.

description:
The hot trend these days seems to be rice bowls with "sushi quality" raw fish and a variety of ingredients to spruce them up into this wondrous meal that makes your eyes roll without giving you an ounce of guilt... sigh... did I say all that?!
Walking to the Financial District from Chinatown, I often see a line here but, for over a year, never stopped or researched them.  A friend suggested getting lunch here on a recent weekday morning.  
Arriving just after noon, as expected, there was a line, but the wait wasn't long.  They had a freestanding message board stating their weekly special, which was their Taka Bowl with sushi rice (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=lEGLmG-P9CPYIVBYGScaew&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q) (think chirashi).  This item consists of Salmon Poke, Spicy Tuna, Crab Salad, Spicy Tobiko, Egg Crepe, Avocado, Mixed Greens, and Seaweed Salad.  The flavors were good and the variety of ingredients made it extremely interesting.  The regular bowl options are white or brown rice as well as mixed greens.  I especially liked the spicy tuna as a nice change of pace.
A few weeks later, I tried the Unagi bowl (https://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?select=lEGLmG-P9CPYIVBYGScaew&userid=saJuyv784apZzH--psHZ3Q).  I was also impressed by my bowl and the variety of flavors and ingredients.  Having tried a couple of the "poke bowl" places in the Bay Area recently, the format is a bit different here as the topping and combinations are designated, making this a no-brainer. 
Though the Yelp page says free miso soup and edamame beans when checking in, it isn't even necessary as they automatically have them waiting for you (the edamame beans, while available, are prepacked at the window corner - if you come after 1 pm, they may run out).
Also, in reading their company's background posted on the wall, they are an authentic Japanese chain which ramps up the credibility in my book.
Another nice perk is, if you sign up for their frequent diner program, you will get a free one after so many meals.
Yes, this is added to my lunch rotation.
And, like my policy regarding restaurants in general, just follow the line!
author: Mike C.

description: This over sushirrito anyday. Great lunch spot! I've had three of their sushi burritos and two types of bowls. Definitely hits the spot for a mid-day meal. Great portion sizes and the staff is hilarious!
author: Eden W.

description:
Ordered a fire bowl! Definitely big portions. I'm a swimmer and anyone who has experience with competitive swimming knows that swimmers eat A LOT! At the end of my meal, I ate everything and was definitely satisfied. The fire bowl comes with seaweed salad, mixed greens, spicy tuna, spicy tobiko, salmon, and tempura bits. On the website, it said that it also comes with the egg crepe, all over a bed of your choice of either white or brown rice (that they put a little teriyaki sauce over to give it some flavor). They were out of brown rice today and also out of the egg crepe because I didn't get any in my fire bowl. 

Fire bowl comes with edamame and miso soup. They are first come, first serve as they only have a limited amount. When I got there, they ran out of edamame. So I didn't have any :( The miso soup comes from a dispenser! I've never had miso soup from a dispenser so I was skeptical. But after tasting it, it was pretty standard with seaweed tempura bits. Would've loved to have some tofu cubes in there though. Fresh sushi, bang for your buck, quick and easy place! Will definitely be back.
author: Cynthia T.

description: Seriously.  Americans will eat anything.  This place is an insult to sushi.  I do not understand why there's a line out the door.  I've tried Taka a couple times and even chatted with the owner (in Japanese and of course, I didn't let on that I wasn't pleased).  The guys are super nice and I really wanted them to be better.  After my last round of mushy rice, mushy fish, crazy salty "miso" soup, cheap non-Japanese style seaweed, and low quality fish eggs, I decided "never again."  This is not Japanese food.  Funny enough, my office-mates call this place "Sushi Kaka."  So, I should have known...
author: Rayu R.

description:
$10.00 will get you a complete package of good rice bowl, edamame and miso soup.

I was on the way to show my friends around San Francisco when I saw this place literally empty with no long lines due to the rain.
so I knew I had to get some.

friendly staff, great value, as good as it gets.

Go FireBowl !
author: Rudy H.

description:
I don't eat raw fish so I never considered Sushi Taka as a lunch option even though my coworkers and friends rave about it. But today my bf was picking up food from Sushi Taka for his coworkers. I decided to walk with him since it's just on Kearny st. and I can grab food somewhere close by afterwards.

When we got to Sushi Taka I noticed that they also had cooked items like chicken teriyaki and shrimp tempura.

I ended up ordering a shrimp tempura burrito and asked them not to include crab, cabbage, and tobiko. I was worried at first because my order was kinda complicated (I'm a super picky eater).

But after a 5 minute wait I was pleasantly surprised that they totally got everything right! Such amazing service! I hope I didn't cause too much inconvenience to their staff.

The meal even came with edamame and miso soup!
author: Julia C.

description:
This is a great place to stop by for lunch because it is quick and delicious. I came here twice with my co-workers during lunch. They give you free miso soup. The restaurant is super small, so there is usually a line that extends outside. I would say typical wait time to order would be 10-15 minutes during peak lunch hours. 

Food: 
1. Super Bowl - Not your typical poke bowl but it is pretty good. They give you a decent amount of cooked eel, but its strangely paired with American lettuce. 

Seating: 
1. None, purely a togo place 

Service: 
1.Once you order, the food comes in 3-5 min max. They have most of the bowls prepared before hand to make the process go quicker.
author: Amy N.

description:
Delicious!! I ordered the salmon poke bowl, and it came with a little tub of edamame and a little tub of miso soup. The salmon was thick, chunky and tasted fresh and buttery! I was very satisfied with the salmon! I would have liked it to have more sauce or flavor, as I found the overall bowl to be a little bland when I mixed everything. (They do give a packet of soy sauce and provide miso dressing at the corner before you exit!)

Staff is friendly! The line can be long and discouraging during lunch hours, but it really goes quick. You order, you pay, you pick up your food and you leave. I hope to be back soon!!
author: Kris C.

description: A scrumptious sushirrito at an affordable price. Reasonable sushi is difficult to secure in the city which is why a clever individual decided to enring potara earrings to a sushi roll and a burrito. The burrito was a tad bit duped in that fusion; nonetheless, burrito-formed anything is usually quite superior to its base form. At Sushi Taka, their fusion was also quite an accomplishment. It's a standard sushirrito, but what really makes it distinct are the potato chips they add into it for a refreshing crisp.
author: Ankur K.

description:
Sushi Taka isn't your typical sushi spot because they specialize in rice bowls and sushi burritos. I'm an avid sushi lover but I do think that the sushi burritos at Sushirrito are a little overhyped. I also don't think that Sushirrito tastes like real sushi... and Sushi Taka does a better job of fulfilling that craving.

At Sushi Taka I ordered the Spicy Taka Roll which consists of salmon, spicy tuna, and imitation crab. It was a really yummy combo and definitely filling for ~$10 - I was full after half but ate the whole thing anyway. It also comes with green salad or miso soup. I like that they offer a brown rice option, and I eat lunch early so there was no wait.
author: Connie Q.

description: Sushi Taka is legit. The crab salad is delicious, and I don't generally love crab salad. The ordering process is a little confusing, but I have ordered the salmon and hamachi bowls several times and have been v pleased. Fresh fish, great serving size, fast and friendly service. There's a little cheaper poke place across the street but this place is worth the money for quality and quantity.
author: Reb T.

description:
Very little to say other than the obvious: phenomenal.

The spicy tuna roll is the way to go. It's packed, the seaweed is crispy, rice perfect, and large enough to fill you up. 

I'd also recommend the Unagi bowl, which was a more than generous portion of both eel and rice.  

Order ahead and skip the line during lunch hours, otherwise you may need to dedicate 15-minutes or more to wait.
author: Hamilton P.

description: This place is really good. I mean it. I enjoyed my meal here and the guy at the front register is a friendly dude. This is my new favorite place in downtown financial district in San Francisco. Really good food.
author: Anthony V.

description:
I feel the need to review this place because I've been watching it deteriorate with time. Hopefully someone from management reads this. I love sushi taka but this place is going downhill fast. Service is going down, portions are getting smaller, food presentation is worse, price is going up, quality is the same. It feels like the way this place is currently run that they are trying to cheap out on most of the stuff that used to make sushi taka a great place. Small things matter, like getting more than one packet of soy sauce makes me feel like I'm begging for it, and that makes me dislike the place even more. Even worse, getting a bag for takeout...
Overall 3 stars.
author: Fady B.

description: Why this place has a line around the block on a daily basis baffles me and further illustrates the fact that there are very few good sushi options downtown. I ordered the fire bowl and could barely finish it. Fish was not very fresh and flavors were bland.
author: Laura D.

description:
1) They don't have tamago by default anymore. Instead they give carrot pickles. The menu on Yelp is outdated.
2) They serve you in a hurry and are impatient most of time. 
3) In order to save space, there is only one table outside with two chairs.


The food quality is amazing for sure. However, it's not worth walking for 15-20 min one way for the price. They always have the attitude that they want to earn as much money as possible from the customers!
author: Eva F.

description: The truffle oil/salt salmon poke is unbelievably satisfying and fresh tasting. Sushi rice is well done along with the egg crepe. So good!
author: Briget P.

description: I orderd the spicy scallop bowl through meal pal, size portion is decent. Taste was ok, nothing much special too it, not too flavorful. Too much rice, orders for meal pal was made in advance and ready to pick up right away upon arrival.
author: SuZy Q.

description:
I actually like coming here for lunch because they give you a lot of food for a good price! They offer bowls and sushi burritos; each time I've come here I've gotten a bowl because I tend to get messy with the burritos. 

I've tried their fire bowl (like a poke bowl with spicy tuna, salmon, tobiko, seaweed salad, salad, egg crepe) and their unagi bowl. Both are great options and are REALLY filling. All dishes come with edamame and miso soup on the side! You also get a choice of brown or white rice as a base. All their fish here is so fresh and they give huge chunks! I was surprised when I came here today and was served big blocks of salmon. And their unagi is smothered in that delicious sauce.. mmmm. Each bowl ranges from $9-$12 and they're good portions!

This place seems really popular as well; I've always seen a line out the door curving along the sidewalk. The service is pretty fast with three people usually in the back; two making the food and one person at the register. I would recommend coming here especially if you don't want to wait in the sushiritto line or want a bowl version of that.
author: Kathleen S.

description:
This place was 5-star. Have  been going there since they opened. lately the bowls have gotten a lot skimpier in terms of fish and toppings. It seems like 30% less. And there was just a small price increase too.

I went back 3 times to confirming the smaller portions before writing this review. If it's not a policy then I got really really unlucky.
author: David P.

description:
Sushi Taka is the closest poke to my office, so I quickly headed over there at 11 AM because I didn't want to bother standing in line with the rest of SF. When I got there around 11:15 today, I was the first and the employee (I think he was the owner) was super friendly. After I ordered my fire bowl and salmon bowl, I swear I didn't even blink 5 times and the first bowl was already made. Amazing!

The salmon poke bowl was very tasty. I would say it's a perfect lunch-size bowl of food. My friend said the fire bowl was a bit spicy for her (she doesn't eat spicy food at ALL. So not bad)

Edamame and miso soup were already placed in containers so you just grab them to the left. Both a bit salty but still good nonetheless.

For the price (~$10/bowl), how fast I got my food (seriously. lightning speed) and good customer service, you can't beat that anywhere else! WOO! I'M A FAN!
author: Cathy C.

description:
MealPal - Taka Bowl on 06/16/17. 

What it is: A poke bowl with chunks of salmon, spicy minced tuna, pickled cabbage and carrots, and crab salad over rice. 

- Salmon chunks - Nicely marinated, tasted fresh. 
- Spicy minced tuna - medium spicy, not bad (often hard to tell with this type of tuna because it's all minced). 
- Pickled cabbage and carrots - Not sure what these are doing in a poke bowl. Picture on MealPal showed seaweed salad, and another MealPal reviewer mentioned she got seaweed salad and tamago. The cabbage and carrots are clearly cheap fillers, even though stuff like seaweed salad and corn aren't expensive and would have been much more suitable.
- Crab salad - typical crab salad, really middle of the road. 
- Rice - mostly okay, some parts mushy. 
- No sauce. :( There was enough flavor but the whole thing was somewhat dry. 

Very filling but based on comparisons with other reviews, the MealPal version is clearly not up to the standards of a "regular" meal here. 3/5 for taste, with 1 star added for value.
author: Alice L.

description:
A line does form even after the typical lunch rush time in this small shop.  I can see why though, the fish is super fresh, and their bowls are so filling!  They're more affordable than Sushiritto and  a little more affordable.  Also, gotta love the 100 health score!  

I came here with a friend after 1PM and there was still a line out the door.  We did get our food fairly quickly though after ordering.  He got the spicy tuna roll ($10.11) and I got the Taka bowl ($10.58).  All orders come with free miso soup.  After getting our orders we sat outside and enjoyed the warm day with our fresh fish at the TransAmerica building.  The spicy tuna roll came rolled up with spicy tuna, crab salad, avocado, radish, cucumber and potato chips.  My taka bowl came with slices of salmon, spicy tuna, crab salad, egg crepe shreds, avocado, seaweed salad, and mixed greens.  I also like for the bowls you can choose between brown rice, white rice and mixed greens.  Next time I'll go for the mixed greens or brown rice.  The fish was super fresh, even the salmon, which at a lot of places can taste super fishy.  The spicy tuna was flavorful and didn't pack a ton of heat, but it was difficult to eat with chopsticks in bowl form, better for the roll since it's more contained in that.  Seaweed salad was nicely dressed with the sesame oil, and the crab salad, though imitation crab was light and delightful. Between the three raw fish bowls, only the salmon poke is the only one that doesn't come with spicy tuna.  I'll try to get that one next time, or a sushi burrito.  My friend enjoyed his spicy tuna roll and I got a bite of it as well.  The potato chips was unusual but a nice surprise inside to make it unique and add even more crunchiness to the cucumbers and daikon.  The miso soup doesn't appear to have tofu bits or seaweed in it, it also has a ton of crunchy bubble looking things in it.  I just passed after two sips.  

All in all, Sushi Taka is a great spot to go for some healthy seafood.  They do offer cooked rolls and bowls too, but, go for the fish for sure!  Raw fish craving totally satisfied here!
author: Cat C.

description:
Sushi Taka is hands down my favorite place of all time. I work a block away, but I would probably travel across town just to get the fire bowl here. I've tried the taka bowl, fire bowl, salmon poke bowl and a couple of their sushi burritos and everything here is FREAKIN BOMB. I've been guilty of eating here 3-4 times a week haha. Everything from the free edamame / miso to the fresh fish and seaweed salad will satisfy any craving you have for some high quality sashimi. I LOVE THIS PLACE. 

tip: you get wayyy more fish when you go later in the day. I usually go around 2 to avoid the lines, and they usually give me almost 2x the amount of fish!
author: Rebecca W.

description:
This spot is a little cheaper than the ever so popular Sushiritto. 

I tried the Sushi Taka Roll ($8.95) and it was pretty darn good! Free miso soup and salad with any order. The miso soup is dispensed through a machine and their free salad is in the fridge for you to take.

They have paper bags for you to put your food in by the condiments area. 

The roll ended falling apart while I was eating it and that made my lunch experience pretty messy...

Regardless,  I will definitely come back here again to try their other food items!
author: Alice X.

description:
The Taka bowl was delicious and under $11. In fidi, that's a great deal! The line was long but the bowl was worth the wait. The staff was really nice and you can record your fivestar card here. Free edamame on the side of the take out joint and free miso soup with Yelp check in! 

There's no seats and it is kind of on the edge of fidi, but it's worth the walk and the wait! I loved the bowl with crab, salmon, tuna and mixed greens over brown rice!
author: Joanna S.

description:
Sushi Taka is my go to sushi roll place for real quality ingredients where the seafood is the star and not the sauce like Sushiritto. When sushiritto first opened it was perfect, but after a few years, the ingredients changed when  they filled it with lots of veggies and rice. The sushi here may not be as huge as Sushiritto, but you can taste the ingredients better without all that sauce. The ingredients are the star after all and shouLd stand out. Once I tried this place there was no looking back. :-) 

I ordered the Salmon roll and it came with free soup and salad which was nice. I don't believe this is on the menu board in the store, but it is listed on their website. If you prefer quality over quantity, I would suggest this place for your sushi rolls. Besides eating too much starch is not good for you, so the size is just right for a burrito sushi. So if you don't want your order, can I have it? It will be yummy in my tummy!  :-).
author: Priscilla L.

description:
I've been here twice and I have to say Sushi Taka is much better than Sushiritto. Their burrito sushi rolls are huge, reasonably priced ($8.95), complementary miso soup included, and service is fast! Right after I placed my order and paid, my sushi burrito was ready!!

I highly recommend both the regular and spicy sushi taka rolls. Both included a good amount of fresh tuna, salmon, cucumber, avocado, seaweed salad, crab salad, and fish roe. The only difference is that the regular roll has wasabi mayo and the spicy roll has kimchi and spicy mayo.

I'll definitely be back when I'm in the Chinatown area.
author: Ashley C.

description:
I prefer Sushi Taka over Sushiritto. The service is SO quick, I literally had my roll in a minute, and the nice guy behind the counter even offered complimentary miso soup.

I ordered the sushi taka roll ($8.95) with salmon, tuna, avocado, cucumber, egg, and seaweed salad inside. I ate half right away for lunch, and saved the other half for dinner. It was really good and tasted even better for dinner, hours later. 

I highly recommend this place. Get here before it closes at 4pm!
author: Corinna T.

description:
Still one of the best bangs for your buck in the FIDI during lunch time. $11 for the fire bowl to go.
I remember when they were just a 2 person operation, but now they have like 6 people in there pumping out sushi bowls.
Although I was used to the nice round bowl before, I don't mind the clear plastic one. Now you can show off your food to the world lol!
There is a line that wraps around the corner of the building everyday, so it shows how popular they have been getting.
I'm a pretty big eater, but I can usually fill up on one of these bowls + edamame and miso soup. However, there are days I'm starving and I request the "Double Fish" (for any raw fish bowl). 2x the fish, you'll have more fish than rice at just a few bucks more.
If you're about to die of starvation, I guess you can go for the "Triple Fish", never really been that hungry before. Pretty sure these options are still on there as part of their ura-menu.
Request the Dragon Bowl if you want Unagi and shrimp tempura.
author: Mike O.

description:
Sushi Taka is one of the places you want to love.  Friendly service, good concept, but the taste of the food only landed at average. 

On the menu are sushi burritos (similar to Sushirrito) and sushi bowls.  All rolls and bowls come with complimentary salad and miso soup dispensed out of a cool little machine.  Both were delicious and I especially liked the tempura crunchies in the miso soup.  

I ordered the crunchy shrimp tempura handroll ($8.95).  It's stuffed with tempura shrimp, avocado, cucumber, crab salad, seaweed salad, tobiko, teriyaki sauce and rolled in tempura crunchies.  I requested for them to leave the tobiko out.  As I took my first couple bites into the roll, I was disappointed that the seaweed salad took over the entire roll.  That's all I tasted.  Each bite was messy as the teriyaki sauce seemed to have thin out and dripped from the bottom.  

In comparison to Sushirrito, Sushi Taka's sushi burritos are slightly smaller, but they're also cheaper.  Sushi Taka's lines are much smaller and neither establishment has a seating area.  

WHAT TO KNOW:
*Limited hours.  Open Monday through Fridays to cater to the working crowd.
*Credit cards are accepted
*They participate in the frequent buyer program, Five Stars
author: Nicole S.

description:
This is the place to hit when coming to Kearny!  

 First walking into this place... It is small and very tight to be honest! It always has a long line which is out the door curving to the side of the building which amazes me! I've got to say that the food is pretty reasonable to order from because you are also able to get the beans and miso soup! I loved what I got which was something with taka and that was just mind blowing ! 

Customer service is just great and cause they are friendly! 

Will love coming back!
author: Brittany L.

description: I'm generally a cheapskate who prefers to bring lunch from home. I've worked in the Fidi for years and it pains me to pay $12 or more for a small amount of unexceptional salad or whatever. That said, I love this place because they give you lots of rice and fresh raw fish for a very fair price(confused about the reviews complaining about small portions tbh). They even throw in a free miso soup. I tend to go at 1 PM and the wait is probably 3 minutes or less. The fire bowl is my favorite.
author: Christine M.

description:
I'm so glad to have found this place. Yes it's like Sushiritto but CHEAPER! Yay! Sadly there's no seating area... Anyway, $8.75 for one big burrito with miso soup and salad! 

I got the spicy taka roll and it's good! Taste fresh and   I love the sweet egg in it. I love the salad dressing too! It's surprisingly so good so I put some on my burrito hehe

They definitely deserve my 5 star :)
author: Debbie D.

description:
If you're in FiDi, craving Sushirito, but in an adventurous mood, Sushi Taka should be on your short list for lunch.    From the outside it doesn't look like much, in fact, you could easily walk right past....but once you step inside, you'll soon discover that the food is high quality and made fairly quickly.  Options are similar to those found at Sushirito, but your sushi burrito from Sushi Taka will be larger and made from similar or higher quality ingredients.  Also, the staff is friendly and very polite.

This spot won't be for everyone, but if you're looking to try something new, I'd give this family owned business a try.
author: Tom G.

description:
Solid place to grab a quick lunch to go. It's not particularly noticeable, so I would have never thought about dropping by if I hadn't found it on Yelp first. Otherwise, it just kind of blends in amongst the many small grab-and-go places in the area.

The menu is pretty small, with a few rolls (aka sushi burritos), bowls and sides. If you check in on Yelp, you can redeem a free salad and miso soup, but the rolls and bowls already come with both. They also accept Five Stars cards: 10 roll/bowl purchases gives you 1 free item under $10. Everything comes out to be about $10 with tax, so it's essentially a free meal.

The rolls are essentially Sushiritto at a cheaper price and smaller size. They're still kind of pricey at $10, but it's FiDi and salads will cost you that much. The size is not super filling but reasonable. Some think Sushi Taka is better, some think Sushiritto is better, but I'm pretty indifferent between the two. Sushi Taka, however, does roll the sushi burritos better in my opinion. They don't fall apart while you're eating them like Sushiritto's do.

The salad was very simple and fresh. The miso soup came out of a machine, which made me kind of skeptical, but it actually tasted just like any other typical miso soup. There was seaweed in it, but instead of the normal tofu, they had some sort of soggy rice puffs.

Service is good here. The staff was very accommodating with my order. I asked for my roll without the wasabi mayo because I find sauces to overpower the real taste of sushi, and I got extra tamago instead of the crab salad. I think my order confused them though because they messed up the first time, but they immediately made a new roll for me, apologizing for the mistake. They make the rolls on the spot, but it's very quick.

====================

I got:

-SUSHI TAKA ROLL ($8.95) - 4/5
[salmon, tuna, avocado, cucumber, seaweed salad, tobiko, crab salad, tamago, wasabi mayo]
Solid roll/sushi burrito. Again, I omitted the crab salad and wassabi mayo so my roll was "lighter" and less creamy than the standard Sushi Taka Roll, and they also added yellow pickled radish. The tuna was a little off to me, but the salmon was pretty fresh and soft in texture. Overall, solid fish. Not the best I've had, but this isn't a fancy sushi restaurant (or a restaurant at all for that matter), so I was satisfied with the quality. Some other Yelpers have said that they're very generous with the fish, but mine was just an average portion. I liked the slight sweetness from the seaweed salad, tamago and pickled radish, and I was really happy that they weren't super heavy on the rice.
author: Jessie L.

description:
Blind taste test proudly posted on the wall rates this higher than SushiRito... And yes I would agree.

If you are liking this Japanese fusion sushi burrito joint.  This is my fav downtown.  Likes goes around the block corner too.

Raw sushi ingredients are fresher and more contrasting complimentary ingredients.
author: David H.

description:
Every time I pass by this street I always see a line around the corner for this hole in the wall.  After 3 years of passing this place I finally decided to come on a rainy day.  I figured rainy day means less people right...?  I was right!  Even if there is a line, it usually goes by quick.  I've tried the Fire Bowl and Super Bowl (their weekly special bc it was the super bowl weekend, ahhh such a clever name...) both were amazing!  The salmon is my favorite.  You can see the fatty lines throughout the cuts.  The spicy tuna is a tad too spicy, but still good.  The avocado that was in the Super Bowl was more like guacamole, which I could've skipped.  

A coworker came along that had gluten allergies and they were very accommodating.  They joked around with her saying, "Yes of course we can adjust for you... it will only take a few hours!"  It was funny until I heard them recite the same joke on 2 people behind her... You jokester you...

Healthy, affordable, friendly service... why are you still reading reviews? GO NOW!
author: Lynn L.

description: Love the salmon bowl here, and it comes with free miso soup too! Even better than sushiritto in my opinion, and shorter line too.
author: Victoria T.

description: Really good tuna poke, and it comes with a miso soup and edamame. I normally go around 12 and it doesn't take too long on the weekdays. I would say the best quality and value poke in FiDi.
author: Lauren A.

description:
Lunch time in the FIDI,
Stand in line,
It goes fast!
Order your bowl,
Tuna and Salmon,
Brown Rice Please!,
Seaweed Salad added,
Fried Little Tempura Bits,
Spicy Tobiko Topping,
Greens also,
Aka Fire Bowl!

Soup included.
On your way,
Get back to work.
Eat in your Office,
What a life?!?

Seriously, I like their Fire Bowl.
author: Scott L.

description:
UPDATE: The owner contacted me to issue an apology and a refund after seeing my review.  While the refund is not necessary, I appreciate that he took the extra step to rectify an issue that has occurred so I've upgraded my rating by a star.  I can't give more than that as I still feel the food was too salty, but I'm more inclined now to give it another try to see if he made the improvements like he said he would.

-------
Got the shrimp tempura burrito which is supposed to come with avocado and cucumber.  I was watching the guy (i think the owner) put it together and didnt see him put it in.  I mentioned this and he said he did.  He didnt even bother to take a look.  I go back to the office, and of course I was right...no green in sight.  For an $11 burrito, I expect everything I paid for to be there esp since I even brought it up.  The balance was def off taste wise without both ingredients...was too salty.  The miso soup also just tasted like salt water and the edamame was way too salty as well.

Mistakes happen, I just didn't care for the nonchalant response given and the food was overly salty.

Better off going to sushiritto or onigilly a few blocks down.  Won't be back.
author: C A.

description:
Ummmm what's the big deal!!! Again with the lines around the corner. 

Ok so my coworkers wanted to try this and I of course had to go along. We waited for about 10 min and got to the inside, which is really small. They took the order quickly and it came out to a reasonable $10.

The food itself was okay, basically like fast food bowls. Who knows is salmon was fresh or from last week (jk) but it was just meh. At least you get miso soup and edamame.
author: Mahsa T.

description:
It is a place if you want bland tasting sushi bowls or sushi burritos. Definitely not high quality or trendy as Sushiritto down the street. I like the fact htough that they have brown rice. Other than that, their free miso soup is out of a machine and tastes processed. 

They do have chicken teriyaki bowls though, which I have gotten once. Again, decent but bland and boring.
author: Annie K.

description:
I read on yelp that the line would be wrapped around the block but I came toward the end of the lunch hours and there was no wait! We got the Salmon Poke Bowl and Fire Bowl and both were quite good. The box is deceiving - at first glance, I thought it was a small portion but by the end I was definitely full. And both bowls also came with a complimentary side of Miso Soup!

There is no seating indoors so that's a con, but there are nearby parks or areas where you can eat your food. Also, when we asked for two cups of water they didn't have proper cups so they served us water in the miso soup bowls (which was odd).

Overall, a good lunch spot but nothing too special!
author: Jennifer D.

description: Very nice people working there but can't understand why the ratings are so high. Threw out my lunch after a few bites when I tried this place a several months ago. My co-worker went there today - got salmon, spicy tuna, crab and said his stomach was unsettled afterward and not all the fish tasted fresh. Make up your own mind but wishing I read a review like this before I tried it... my co-worker's response is what prompted me to write this.
author: Win S.

description:
Since poke has become v hot and trendy, a lot of places have added poke to their menus BUT I feel like a lot of places have poke bowls with a bunch of random things that kind of take away from the flavor of the fish. The salmon poke bowl here is fairly simple, which is what I think makes it good (and how it should be IMO lol). The salmon poke is shoyu style and also comes with seaweed, the egg crepe thingies, tobiko, and crab salad on top of rice. Everything is good and when I get it via the mealpal app it's like $6ish? not baaaaaddddd

I've only had Sushi Taka through the mealpal app, but I think the quality of the food here is actually really good here (which is obvs key when eating raw fish) so I'll probably be back to try more!
author: Terra C.

description: This is the perfect lunch spot for FiDi workers - quick, delicious, and at a reasonable price point! I always get the Taka Bowl, which consists of spicy tuna and salmon along with seaweed salad, imitation crab, shredded carrots, fried onions, an avocado slice, and rice. The salmon is so fresh and it's all just so...good! The portion of each component is on point too, so I'm never stuck with too much rice at the end of my meal. It's a great bang for your buck (~$12; an average price for a poke bowl) because the bowl is extremely filling and you also get miso soup and edamame with your order. Sometimes the line can look daunting, but the restaurant itself is just small and the workers are FAST! I'm in and out in less than 10 minutes, which is a miracle during the lunch rush hour. They have a virtual stamp card program, so I recommend using it so that you can eventually get a free bowl (something that I neglected to do until my third bowl)!
author: Shannen N.

description:
Located in Chinatown.
 
For a little under $10 you get a decent size Fire Bowl (Spicy Tuna, Salmon, Spicy Roe, Tempura Flakes Seaweed Salad) Edamame and a small miso soup.  They offer other bowls like Salmon Poke, Unagi, Beef, Chicken Teriyaki, and Tofu.  They also offer sushi burritos like Sushirrito.  I haven't tried any other item on the menu except the Fire Bowl because for me, it was love at first bite!  Everything is made fresh to order and the service is fast.
 
There's no seating at this corner locale so it's take out only.  The line can get quite long at around 12:30 so if you arrive around noon to 12:15, the wait should not be long.
author: Scott L.

description: My new favorite sushi spot! I got the taka bowl with sushi rice and it came with a miso soup! The salmon, tuna, and scallop was so fresh. I'll definitely be coming back!
author: Stephanie P.

description:
Absolutely love this place. Work about a half mile from here and it's so convenient. First time I went I walked in and ordered. No line, super friendly staff and took less than 3 minutes from order to out the door. I ordered be shrimp tempura burrito and got a bowl of miso too. The burrito as a whole was delicious, rice was fresh and sticky just like sushi rice, and all the ingredients as a whole worked together to just make a delicious burrito. Only thing to look out for is it's a little salty-- so if sodium is not your thing skip the extra soy sauce they provide for you. I've also used yelp to place pick up orders three times now. Every time my burrito is ready by the time I walk there. And they're very organized about the pickup system. In and out, perfect for a busy day at the office.

Overall the staff is kind, the shop is small but fast paced and the food is delicious. Great for a quick and filling lunch!
author: Ali F.

description: Great place for a healthy lunch for us fish lovers. I had the unagi bowl with rice, great portion and value, fast service and everything looks fresh. It also came with a miso soup and edamame.
author: Inga W.

description:
Came here on a weekday during lunch and go the salmon bowl.  As others have noted, it comes with a little container of miso soup and edamame.  The food was fine, but didn't have that much fish and was somewhat bland.  With the explosion of Poke places popping up all over the place, this would be considered on the low-end.  A little cheaper than others, but not that cheap either.  

Make sure to come early or late for lunch, because lunch traffic starts about 11:30 and the lines get large quickly.
author: Denis S.

description:
