Solid sushi bowl and burritos! You will see a line outside but like everyone has stated, the line moves quickly and the people take your order while you wait in line to pay. 

I got the taka bowl and it was a decent size! Bonus that you don't have to check in to get the edamame and soup! They automatically give it to you! 

The people in front of me got the burrito and it was like the size of my forearm. The people there even had trouble wrapping it up. 

I would def recommend this place over the other sushi bowls in the area. Service is way faster and the salmon was really fresh! 

Bonus that they also have stamp cards! Get that free bowl!
author: Sarah I.

description: Lots of fast customer turnover during lunch time, which makes for some really fresh sushi.
author: Lars K.

description: I got the spicy bowl - amazing portion for $11 after tax. Decent amount of fresh salmon and didn't have to pay extra for brown rice. Well seasoned. The only thing I didn't like was that the miso soup was too salty, which doesn't really matter because I didn't know it came with miso soup and edamame.
author: Val L.

description: Outstanding takeout in the financial district. For vegetarians, the tofu rice bowl and tofu burrito are very satisfying. There are a lot of complementary and interesting flavors going on that keep your taste buds delighted, between the shredded, marinated carrots, seaweed, crispy fried onions, sesame seeds, avocado, cucumber, sauces, tofu and sometimes their newest ingredient, tofu nuggets...small formed patties with a crust and a shredd-y firm texture...you may find yourself mindfully eating your lunch to enjoy all the combinations you can make. The staff are warm and welcoming, a nice trend that seems to be catching on downtown. Do not be deterred if there is a line, as it moves quickly. Late eaters often find that the brown rice and the complimentary edamame have run out.
author: Ginny N.

description: Love this place. It's not the cheapest (the bowls run anywhere from $10-12) but the quality is really good and it always hits the spot. You can also add additional ingredients if you want and customize it how you'd like (for an additional cost). The line gets really long but they run it factory style so you're actually not even waiting very long at all for your food. It's definitely a weekday lunch spot only. The big downside to me is that this place isn't open for dinner or on the weekends :(
author: Diana Y.

description: First time here and man, the longer you wait the longer the line but they are super efficient! I ordered the Beef Bowl with no seaweed salad and damn! Delicious! You also get a free miso soup and edemame (sp?) when you order the burrito or bowl. They also have a rewards program for eating there. Service is top notch and super friendly (from the cashier to the guys making the food). Will come here again since I am literally across the street. Great tasting food for sure!
author: A o S.

description:
I LOVE Sushi Taka. The food is great! They are a small shop so their variety is limited however, they do so much with what they have. Even better than the food is the people who work there. They are always so genuinely sweet and accommodating. 
My friends and I work in the area and I love picking up a bowl or sushi burrito before work!
author: Samantha S.

description: I got the Taka bowl with free miso soup and edamame. It reminds me kind of of a poke bowl with the spicy raw salmon, fish roe, imitation crab, and avocado, rice and various veggies. It was very flavorful and the portion was satisfying. I'll be stopping by again for lunch soon!
author: Michelle C.

description: The food is fresh and the staff will go above and beyond for service.  It is a very popular place, but they take time to take my order.  Good portion and great price for the Financial District .
author: Shuki C.

description:
Several people compare Sushi Taka to Sushirito... It's a fair comparison. Menu doesn't have as many options as Sushirito and isn't as nice inside, but Taka is slightly better.

They do a giant spicy tuna roll or bowl (with brown rice option).  I'd go elsewhere if craving sushi, but am ok stopping in for a cheap protein and mayo filled bite. Also, free miso soup with purchase.

Very friendly, provide decent quality at a great price. Plus they have spam musubi. Not my first choice for sushi but is okay.
author: Zoran L.

description: The lunch rush can get crazy, but it goes very fast! Very decent, generous portion of various bowls / styles of sushi burrito, they also give you free edamame and miso soup! Really decent. Only thing is there's no place to sit :/
author: stacey k.

description:
Solid poke bowls. Decently priced for SF. Each order comes with a small cup of (salty) miso soup with crunchies, and you can get edamame and crispy tempura topping if you want. 

Service is very friendly, and bowls are made-to-order. They also have a rewards program. 

My one complaint would be that the rice is usually pretty cold and hard -- would be yummier with fresh/warm rice.
author: Jackie Y.

description: Compared to So Cal  S.F. sushi is NOT worth it. Was super disappointed with the  amount of fish on top of rolls. Like 25 % of roll for more $ than anywhere I've been
author: Ken B.

description:
05.24.16 | bookmarked 02.08.12

Better and cheaper Sushirito. Serves sushi bowls in addition to the giant rolls. Each order comes with edamame and miso soup.

Line can get long but moves rather quickly. No seating, so find yourself a nice public park nearby and enjoy the lunch!

Total damage for a fire bowl: $10.50
author: Jenny L.

description:
This is a popular lunch time spot.  There's usually a line out the door, but they are efficient.  I have only been here twice, but have not waited for more than 10 minutes both times.  

I ordered the fire bowl both time and it was awesome.  Their fish (salmon and spicy tuna) is fresh and they drizzle a tasty sauce over the bowl.  I also really like the seaweed salad and the eggs that come in the bowl.  Everything just works really well.  The portion is large AND they give you a miso soup and edamame.  It's one of the better deals around.
author: Carrie L.

description:
This used to be one of my favorites places in the financial district however they have changed for the worst.

The portions are now less and bowls cost more.

The presentation has changed for the worst.

Taka bowl used to come with an avocado mixture, now just a plain half avocado slice

Double fish is more like 1.5x fish, again with the portions shrinking


They have changed for the worst since their health score has been revised. At least the fish still tastes good.
author: Nadim K.

description:
Ordered the Fire bowl, there was no "fire", but it was mighty tasty! They give you generous amounts of fish and free sides of edamame and miso soup. No worries, they have sriracha in the condiments section for the fire factor. A well spent $9-10. 
 
NOTE: On your first visit, you can save $1 when you sign up for the 5 star reward program.
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Fresh seafood, good portions, healthy options, and cheap prices? Sushi Taka has won me over for lunch. This is a grab and go type of place with only 2 or so tables outside for sitting (and not with the best ambiance too).The interior is tiny so the line can go out the door pretty quick - come early or late! Service is pretty fast though, I came at 1:30PM once and only had to wait a few minutes. 

I usually get a bowl because there's so much and I save the rest for later (although it's not good to let seafood sit for too long even if it's in the fridge). The bowls are pretty much like a poke bowl - although not quite as authentic. You can also get a sushi burrito which I haven't tried, but looks comparable to sushiritto. The only weird thing in the bowl was the avocado sauce. At first I thought it was wasabi but when I tried it, it tasted like avocado and water... The bowl would be MUCH better if it were served with avocado slices/cubes instead of this "sauce". I think they probably primarily use it for the burrito and just put it on the bowl for convenience. 

Regardless, I think I've found a go-to place for lunch!
author: Evelyn C.

description: I work in the area and have seen this eatery numerous times with long lines, so I thought I'd give it a try. I ordered the fire bowl with white rice (my preference is brown rice, but they were sold out of that...all good). I also received a miso soup. Both the poke bowl and miso soup were good! The food is fresh, customer service is friendly, and pricing is affordable. I plan to go back!
author: Stacie S.

description: This is a great spot for lunch. I get their meals through MealPal and it's nice to be able to skip the line. Decent amount of food and fresh fish always. I will say the line is long usually, but with MealPal you don't have to wait in line!
author: Alexis L.

description: The seafood is always fresh and the food never disappoints. They're similar to sushiritto where they have sushi burrritos but I like getting their sushi bowl. I like the spicy tuna bowl the most. They give you free edemame and miso soup for lunch until they run out:)
author: Lisa C.

description: I ordered a sushi bowl with salmon, spicy tuna, and imitation crab. It came with a side of miso soup and edamame. The soup had rice crispies or something like that in it...it was weird, but ok. The bowl had a good amount of fish, but it also had a little bit of lettuce and the egg was sliced really thin almost like shredded eggs. I was disappointed the avocado was almost like a guacamole. If the egg was in chunks and avocado was really sliced, I'd be a bit more happier. I was extremely disappointed with the quality of the entire meal.
author: Christina L.

description:
Love this place. The fire bowl is the best deal around. And it is really tasty. The guys are always so nice and happy every time I come here , and I come at least once a week. Also, miso soup and edamame is free with your purchase. 

If you do want to come, make sure to come early on take a late lunch because normal lunch rush has a line out the door and around the corner.
author: S. S.

description:
This is one of those places you kinda walk by and not notice, but notice. It's a strange description but it works. It's one of those places that doesn't really catch your eye, but you see it because it's on the corner of the busy block of Kearny for Fidi people looking for lunch. 

This place isn't anything fancy on the inside at all. It looks small and dinky. The menu is straight forward. You can't find it online, but I posted readable pictures. There's nothing more that irks me than a place without an accessible online menu. I like to know what I'm in for before going to a place. 

I got the fire bowl because it had more ingredients and it was the same price as the dragon bowl. EXCEPT for the fact that I didn't get any kimchi in my bowl, unless it was there and I didn't see it or eat it. That was strange. The bowl looks super full, which is great, but it's a little rice heavy. Regardless, it's still a hearty meal. The fish tasted fresh, unlike some of the reviewers. Maybe I got there on a good day? 

With your bowl or roll, you get a salad and miso soup (if you choose to do so, they will ask if you want a free salad and soup -- why wouldn't you say yes?). The miso soup comes out of a machine, so it's not the best but it's free... so it's decent. 

I'll come back to try out the other bowls to see if there's much of a difference... I don't think there will be but at least it's a easy way to get a hearty bowl of rice and fish.
author: Jeannie L.

description:
Got a chicken teriyaki bowl after Labor Day on Tuesday. 

The Chicken was dry like a bark of tree and pretty bland.

On thorough inspection I think the chicken is left over from Friday before Labor Day. 

Now I have a severe diarrhoea which was bad enough from eating at another sushi place down town last week called Tokyo express. 

I will suggest to avoid both places. Health and safety people should shut them down.
author: Sam B.

description: Line out the door, but they move quickly. I got the salmon roll and it was delicious. Simple, but delicious. Orders come with free edamame and miso soup, but those are nothing special. I haven't tried their bowls but their rolls are better than Sushirrito.
author: Christel L.

description: First time customer. The Fire bowl is awesome. It's a hit of spicy. Not flaming lips or so. :) I definitely love come back. Its fast too, i walked in ( did not order for pick up) pick what I want to order and pay. Comes with miso soup. Walk back to my office and only a block away. And enjoy the quick order and yummy fish with roe!
author: Leeto B.

description:
Since I heard that the lines get long here, I came to a late lunch around 2, when there was no one in line at all. I walked right up, bought my lunch ($10.50), and they almost immediately handed me my fire bowl. Pretty great! As other reviews mention, there is indeed no real seating inside and the staff are quite friendly.
As for the food, both the free miso soup and the fire bowl were delightful! The miso soup is pretty much like all other good miso soups, so no need to go into detail there. The fire bowl definitely exceeded my expectations. All the ingredients, particularly the fish (salmon and spicy tuna), were nice and fresh. The spicy mayo added a nice little kick to the combo as well. Excellent.
Will eat there again.
author: Laura B.

description: One of the best lunch places in the Financial District. The fire bowl is amazing. It's best to get there a little before noon to avoid the long line.
author: Meghan M.

description:
I love this place!  Super convenient lunch spot. 

For 10$, you get a sushi bowl, edamame, and miso soup.  The sushi bowls alone are very filling - the edamame and miso soup are just added bonuses! 

Lines can get ridiculously long - your best bet is to come around 11:50 or right at 12:00 - I made the mistake of coming at 12:30 last week and was stuck waiting in line for 20 minutes.  The inside is very small - no space for seating, so this is a grab and go type of place.  If your office isn't close by (or you don't have a go to spot to sit and eat), you may want to pass on this place.

The staff is super friendly! It's always the same guys working, and they have a great attitude. 

Sign up for the rewards card!
author: Ashlee C.

description: definitely one of my favorite lunch spots in the fidi! i ordered the unagi bowl for $11.04 plus tax = $12. all orders include a free miso soup & edamame. they also don't charge you for paper bags. how awesome is that? the down side is that this isn't a sit down restaurant, but there are plenty of POPO spaces in the fidi for you to enjoy your lunch! the unagi bowl was delicious. don't be intimidated by the long line; it moves quick. the sushi burritos here are definitely better than sushirrito! they use five stars rewards program, so make sure you sign up!
author: Sylvia H.

description: Great poke bowl! Had the salmon with crab, egg, seaweed, and rice. It was really good and the staff was nice. The bowl also came with free miso soup with a check-in on yelp
author: Russell W.

description:
I'm a regular Sushi Taka client for more than a year now. Both myself and my wife love their raw salmon rolls and bowls. There is nothing fried in it, like in Sushirrito, so it is not only tastes deliciously, but is also a healthier choice for those, who cares.

One of my favourite spots in SF! Absolutely recommended!
author: Denis R.

description:
I've been going to this lunch spot for maybe 2x a week now...it's my substitution to my 4x a week subway :)

My favorite so far is the Fire Bowl.  It consists of seaweed salad, mixed greens, spicy tuna, spicy tobiko, salmon, and tempura bits.  Fire Bowl is $9.50 and it comes with hot miso soup.  

Service is usually fast (I come around 3ish maybe that's why).

This spot is just a block away from work, so that's a plus.
author: Erick L.

description: Very close to my building. Always fresh food, friendly and fast service. Although the line gets a bit long sometimes, makes waiting in the cold undesirable. My poki bowl go-to place!
author: Julie T.

description: I haven't been here in quite awhile but Sushi taka has unfortunately downgraded. They changed their containers which either makes it seem portions have become smaller, or the amount really is less than before. And the prices are more expensive.  I understand prices must go up, but for the portion to go down with it? It doesn't make sense to me. I ordered the taka bowl and asked for no salmon, and instead get more of the spicy tuna. Instead I got a small portion of tuna and a heaping amount of crab. Plus the rice was cold! What Asian restaurant serves cold rice with their entree?! It was just an overall sad lunch. If I wrote a review last year, it would deserve a 5!
author: Sharyn Y.

description:
Tried it on MealPass. They are always sold out so it was not easy to get the meal. Got the chicken teriyaki bowl and picked it up today.

Long line, which I didn't realize I could skip with MealPass. I guess miso soup is not included with MealPass but a kind woman in the shop said she didn't want hers and gave it to me. (Thanks to you, whoever you are.)

The food was good. A little rice-heavy ... craving more protein and more sauce. I don't like to eat a lot of empty carbs, doesn't feel good in my body. I liked the seaweed salad and a good combo of flavors. Maybe my expectations were too high.
author: Erika A.

description: It was my first time and I tried the Taka Bowl. The salmon had a slight bad fishy taste and the avocado was a little brown.  I wish the ingredients were more fresh. I'm pretty disappointed compared to the poke places in LA.
author: Edmund W.

description:
I'm an avid fan of Sushirrito so I was pretty excited to try this place out. For roughly similar prices (Sushi Taka is a dollar or two less expensive depending on what you choose), Sushi Taka's sushi burritos are noticeably smaller but more delicious. You can tell the head chef really cares about his product. 

With your purchase, you also get a small cup of edamame and miso soup for free so it's just as filling as a Sushirrito. Although I wasn't a fan of the rice-krispy-like tofu in my miso soup, the soup itself was very bold with flavor.

I'll definitely come back and maybe try the sushi bowl next time (they remind me of chirashi but don't break the bank!) The cashier said that they are more well known for their bowls and that they are also more filling!
author: Jannet H.

description: Yummmaayy. It really is better than Sushirrito, and cheaper I do think. My friend and I went halfsies on the spicy tuna roll and the wasabi salmon roll. The ingredients were actually exactly the same except for the fish, which made all the difference. Stating the obvious but, spicy tuna roll was spicy and had that spicy tuna flavoring, while the wasabi salmon roll was a bit lighter and well, more wasabi-flavored...That's basically what it comes down to. There was a lot of imitation crab, and funnily, ruffles chips for texture. I could've done without the miso soup and the edamame was a bit too salty. I could eat this on the daily.
author: Jennifer H.

description: Great place for take out lunch. I ordered the fire bowl, with brown rice. The fish was very fresh and had good flavor. I love the concept of fresh sushi grade fish in a bowl. Super fast and very friendly service.
author: Laura M.

description:
Sushi Taka is the best deal downtown.  Great poki bowls and burritos.  Quality sushi burritos.  Better than Sushirrito and Ohana.  Been loyal customer since it opened.  Back then no lines but secret is out.  Lines move fast.    

Also on Mealpal
author: Albert L.

description:
Hm...maybe they're having an off day? Who knows. 

I guess I am a sushi snob? I got the Fire Bowl. It has various things in like sashimi tuna and salmon, imitation crab, avocado, kimichi, etc. I was so excited to try it cause it looked really bomb from what I saw. I got back to the office and it was rather fishy. Not the fresh kind of fishy...but kind of.....not fresh kind of fishy if that makes sense? Hah. I was willing to give it a try. Took my first bite...it was ...ok. I had a piece of salmon and honestly, it's not the kind of salmon I'm use to. It was very vein-y compared to other sashimi I've had. Was not my cup of tea. Then, the tuna, it was..once again...ok. Cut into small bite size pieces. It was really dyed because it kind of seeped into my rice. On the plus side, they gave me a LOT of imitation crab.

Other than that...I thought this place was just ...ok. My coworker couldn't finish her burrito like sushi because she said the seaweed was just too much for her. I could tell the staff were Japanese and the girl at the counter was very nice but....def. not my cup of tea. Think I'll stick to my usual sushi burrito place....

Oh and all meals I think comes with salad and miso soup. My coworker had the salad and she said it was very fresh, which is a plus.
author: Denise L.

description:
Sushi Taka over Sushirrito 

Fire bowl all day! Awesome staff! They definitely know how to work a long line in a productive manner.  Menu is straight forward and they will not cheat you out of portions. I used to save half to eat later in the day but it's just too good!  That Miso soup machine they got, I need for the house! I like how they also have a point system, not many eateries in SF have them so it's definitely a great way of bringing clients back.
author: Neil M.

description:
Sushi taka is the best of its kind. I usually get the bowls and am never disappointed. The Fire bowl is the way to go! Compared to sushiritto, there is so much more flavor here. The people are always nice and they get you in and out, fast. The line can look long, but the wait ends up being short and the food is worth it! 

Thanks, sushi taka!
author: Ann N.

description: It was okay, not that amazing, especially not for the price. $11.50 for a (small) Shrimp Tempura Sushi Burrito. Sushirrito prices are similar, but at least their portions are more generous. I wouldn't come back again.
author: Michelle T.

description: Reasonably priced for the quality. Fast service. Consistently excellent. Can't ask for more than that! Considering I gave 5 stars to Akikos for sushi quality, can't quite call this that level, but a very solid 4. I will be back for lunch bowls likely 1x a week.
author: Sai S.

description:
Finally I stopped by and have tried their sushi burrito!  I have the feeling that two out of 3-4 guys working there use to work in sushirrito before. Bananaz!!! I liked the place and definitely will come back to try more of their items. For the first try I decided to get spicy tuna roll, an it was great! Seaweed salad was a it too much but it's only my opinion, someone else might just love it!
They're really fast, ingredients are fresh, roll was stuffed with the fish, which is awesome but what really made me happy were prices! After sushirrito decided to go insane on their prices I was looking for some substitution, who's prices won't make me cry. Finally! That's my new "craving fish mood" gem! Really curious to try their bowls! Yummmmzzzz
author: Asiyat T.

description:
Similar to sushiritto, except that you can customize your rolls here, which I really like. There's free salad and miso soup that comes with your customized roll. However, I do find that the size of the roll is rather small compared to sushiritto, making it a more expensive meal. 

Nonetheless, I did enjoy my customized roll very much and look forward to having it again!
author: Christina N.

description:
Disclaimer: This review is solely for their office catering!

So, I'll keep this pretty simple: we've had the folks from Sushi Taka come over to our office a few times to make on-the-spot sushi rolls/burritos a la Sushirrito, using fresh ingredients (especially the fish!) and deliciously seasoned sushi rice, albeit going a bit heavy on the rice unless you specify otherwise. All in all though, they serve up a pretty tasty meal.
author: Johnny W.

description: Good grab-and-go sushi bowls, basically poke by a different name without the customization options. The fish tastes fresh and it's a solid deal including miso and edamame. Don't be put off by the line, it moves quickly. If you like spicy, definitely add wasabi or Sriracha to the fire bowl, as it isn't that hot to start with.
author: Thomas H.

description:
This is the better tasting version of Sushiritto: more fresh and a relatively well-kept secret! 
And health conscious folks can rejoice for their brown rice option.

Bonus: free miso soup and mixed green salad if you're among the first 70 customers. Taking a 2pm lunch I got the last soup and salad, but they had run out of brown rice by this point. 

Note: nowhere to sit and no A/C. Quick but careful service. All about the takeout.
author: Stephanie T.

description: This restaurant is HORRIBLE  , alot of people love it but little did you know they have roaches  , once a Salmon fell  on the Floor and they just washed it with water and still served it . . Don't trust it
author: Mayra S.

description:
Sushi Taka is on a corner close to the edge of China Town. Parking was difficult to find since we didn't want to park in the lot that is under the park. When we finally found some parking, we walked to the restaurant. It's a relatively small place that does not have seating inside. 

My boyfriend ordered the Sushi Taka Roll, while I ordered the Spicy Sushi Taka Roll. There is a check in offer of a free Miso soup if you order a roll, so we each got a miso soup as well. We walked down to the park and sat on a bench to eat. Both rolls were both very good, but I preferred the spicy roll more because I enjoy that kick. I enjoyed the fresh smell of the seaweed when I took a bite. I tried adding a little bit of soy sauce to the roll but it definitely didn't need it. 

Some may say that this place is better than Sushirrito. I feel a little bit indifferent. Although Sushirrito does have bigger rolls, I like that Sushi Taka has a roll that includes both salmon and tuna, or that you have the option of making your own. I enjoy the simplicity of Sushi Taka's rolls.
author: Cathie N.

description:
I was visiting SF and wanted to try this sushi burrito I kept hearing about. I trusted yelp and ventured out to sushi taka and I am so glad I did!!

It definitely isn't a sit down place and they have a very limited menu, but it works for them! The staff was friendly. I ordered the spicy taka roll. Took my breath away! I walked a few blocks back to my hotel and it was so fresh and in tact when I got there. I was afraid it would have too much rice but it was a perfect amount of everything and each bite had a bit of everything. My mouth was pretty happy!

If I ever go back to SF, this would be my first stop! Would love to try the other things on the menu. Keep it up!!
author: Racquel P.

description:
I got the salmon and tuna roll with Kanikama (regular fish cake), guacamole, and chili mayo (~$8). I wished they called the guacamole something else.. like Avocados? Something about guac in my sushi makes me feel a bit uneasy.

I don't know if I'd opt to go here again just because I work closer to Sushiritto and felt like in comparison, I got more fish for my money. It's a different kind of taste at Sushi Taka but for $8, I couldn't help but still feel a little hungry.

People working are nice and efficient. Everything came out so fast and i was in and out within a few minutes. There was no line when we got there. Oh it was a weekday at around 12:30 PM.
author: Lauren K.

description: Love, love, love the spicy tuna roll. Plenty of tuna, plenty of crab salad, good balance of ingredients. Nothing to hate. Dying to try the shrimp tempura roll next!
author: Winston C.

description: I came here and got their standard sushi bowl. It includes spicy fish roe, spicy tuna, salmon, tamago, seaweed, lettuce, seaweed flavored rice krispies and a bunch of mayo. The rice was unfortunately lacking in vinegar flavor and I think was just plain white rice, but the toppings were reasonably fresh and flavorful and dumping a whole lot of spicy mayo and soy sauce of course made it better. It's not really that healthy and I'm a stickler for sushi rice to taste like sushi rice, so I'm giving it a pass next time.
author: Jin C.

description:
Poor knockoff of Sushirrito at similar prices. Also, there's no longer any green tea rice, which was mentioned in previous Yelp reviews. There's probably new management now. It's an order and go type of place with no seating inside.

Prices run from $9-11 for either a sushi bowl or a DIY sushi burrito. 

The $1 (or free with Yelp check-in) miso soup was dispensed from a machine, but it surprisingly tasted pretty good!
author: Audrey L.

description:
Great place and great food. I ordered the Unagi roll. Complimentary Misu Soup and Salad with all order rolls and bowls. Orders are made right in front of you so you know that it's fresh. Also they provide bags for your order.

The fillings inside the sushi roll is great. Comes with seaweed which I've never seen that before in any of the places I've been too. Just the salad and Miso Soup has filled me up that I've only been able to eat half of the Unagi roll.   

Price isn't to bad. The Unagi Roll cost me $8.95 that doesn't include tax.
author: M M.

description:
Great lunch spot in SF when you work around Montgomery. The line is always on the longer side but the employees are super efficient and crank out food like nobody's business. Be ready when you're up so you don't piss everyone else in line off! 

The bowls are incredibly filling and worth the 12-15 dollar price tag. There are also sushi burrito options if you're into that, but they didn't seem to be on par quality wise with the bowls. 

It's A super small space but not sketchy quality at all! I found the fish to be fresh and the greens crisp and delicious. 5/5!
author: Hailey H.

description: Delicious!!!! I'm so glad I found this place near work! I ordered dragon bowl for less than $10 and it comes with free soup and salad. The place is small but clean, long line during lunch hours but it is worthy. Will come back again!
author: Karla S.

description: For a take out lunch sushi location, it simply can't be beat. Great food, great staff, great ownership, I've been going to this place since opening day and it just gets better and better. Avoid the noon rush else there will be a long line.
author: King O.

description:
Good prices, all inclusive with salad and miso soup. Fast and friendly service is a plus. Fivestars so buy 10, get 1 free.

I always get one of the two bowls (usualy the fire bowl) and it fills me up!
author: Wilson T.

description:
Came here after a recommendation from a friend that it is a better version of sushiritto. The staff was very nice and I really wish that I liked the food more, but it just did not click with me. Maybe I just ordered the wrong thing.

I ordered the sushi burrito with unagi, and while there was a big portion of unagi, it just tasted bland. Their miso soup comes out of a machine, and I think it might have not been working properly the day I went because there were clumps of what seemed like miso paste in the soup.


I really like the folks who worked behind the counter though, and will probably give it another shot in the future.
author: Jeff M.

description:
The concept is very similar to sushirrito, but you also have the option to get a bowl instead of a large burrito (which is essentially a sushi roll that hasn't been cut yet). 

I came here after looking for something new to eat in the financial district, as I tend to just grab-and-go from across the street and it can get realllly old fast. The prices are reasonable for the FiDi ( less than $10) but the bonus is your order also comes with a side salad and miso soup. I was hesitant with the miso soup at first, considering it's dispensed from a machine, but surprisingly it's not bad. I did think it was a little on the salty side.  

I ordered the spicy taka roll, which was pretty large and came with plenty of fish (more salmon than tuna IMO). You also had the option to add extra fish for $1.50, but I opted not to on my first try. I like how there's not a ton of things going on, its a generous portion but everything is kept simple. Side note: The spicy taka, contrary to the name, is not spicy at all. 

It's a bit of trekk for me from my office, but if I'm really in the mood for a stroll I'll be back!
author: Kim C.

description:
Very fresh and a wide variety of flavors. 

I'll be going here on a regular basis until the line is too long and I assume that wont be too far off.  

I tried the Salmon with Egg and Curried Chicken Salad.

The price to happiness is great and about $7 for a great lunch.
author: Justin S.

description:
I personally prefer this to sushiritto. The price is more affordable and the portions are smaller, so you don't feel as gluttonous afterwards. I got the spicy taka roll, which was pretty good and stuck together really well. I think for about a dollar more, you can also get more fish, but I think it comes with enough fish already. The rolls also come with a complimentary salad and miso soup.

The place is pretty small and doesn't have a sit down area, so it's definitely more of a to-go place. The owner is also super nice and friendly.
author: Jean J.

description:
I don't mind the small portion or higher price. But a roll full of bony, rubbery unagi is unforgivable. Earns stars only for the sweet cashier service. The worker in the back roll my sushi looked very unhappy though. No love when making food inevitably leads to a disappointing and lackluster meal.

VERDICT: won't be back.
author: Stephanie L.

description:
Overall it's a creamy and spicy roll. Not sure if I am a supporter of kimchi in sushi after this experience. The kimchi flavor is way too dominant. Size equates to about 8-10 pieces of sushi. Very generous with the roe and tuna and salmon sashimi so expect a price of $9.78. 

Tip: Happy hour from 1:30-2:30pm! All their shelves items (Spam masubi rice balls, sushi platter, shrimp potstickers, etc) are all 50% off. Prices range from $1.84- $6.99 depending on the item. I'd come back for that! 

Also super smiley and polite Japanese man that greets you when you enter and when you leave. 5 stars for that.
author: Joanna H.

description: So happy to have found such a great new lunch spot! Came across this place with my coworker on our way from picking up her dry cleaning. Ordered the fire bowl ($10) and it came with salmon and spicy tuna, lettuce, rice and spicy sauce. It also came with a little side of crunchy tempura toppings. There are a bunch of lunch places in fidi that have sushi burritos and sushi bowls but I have to say that I thought this was the best, especially for the price! There was a line when we got there but it wasn't more than a 20 minute wait. The staff and chef are also super nice, which was a huge plus!
author: Charissa S.

description: Sushi Taka is a slightly cheaper and less Americanized version of Sushirrito. They offer numerous preset assortments of sushi burritos, but one can also make a DIY roll with one's choice of ingredients: I got the unagi, egg, pickled radish, and all the veggies for ~$10, average for lunch in FiDi. One con is that I think the rolls are smaller than Sushirrito's. However, the service is more inviting. The cashier and maybe owner is a very sweet Japanese man who graciously bowed/nodded with every little interaction, brought us cups of water when we chose to sit in the small and kind of cramped restaurant space, and urged us to hand him our trash for him to dispose of after we were done eating. While Sushi Taka's food is smaller and flavors perhaps simpler than those of Sushirrito, I like the small business atmosphere of the former and would be happy going there again.
author: Amy G.

description:
It's sushiritto, but cheaper; a knock off of the chain that is spreading like wildfire all around the bay area, and it is just as good.  They are also pretty fast with your order and have never been too crowded when I got there.

All in all, the food is good, reasonably priced, but I wouldn't say it is the most amazing lunch I have ever had (even in the Financial District).
author: Adam Z.

description: This place is solid.  We got a poke bowl with grab, tuna, and salmon added spicy mayo and it was perfect for 2 people to share.  Definitely thought the ingredients were fresh and the flavors were there.  The guy at the cash register was really nice and made recommendations and gave us extra miso which was nice.  I would come back again given it was a good sized bowl for 12 bucks.
author: Diana D.

description: I found strips of plastic in my sushi bowl. A health hazard to say the least. I went back to the restaurant and pointed this out to one of the employees - Uriel Castro - who told me he is the manager and made it seem like it was no big deal and since they make 300 bowls a day there was bound to be plastic in some food! He did offer me a replacement or a refund but had an attitude like they did nothing wrong and this was par for the course for a busy food establishment. I would have appreciated an acknowledgement of a serous quality control issue and a commitment to correct it going forward but was very disappointed to see how they reacted.
author: Karan K.

description: Fresh salmon and good prices. The portion could be a bit bigger and more fish selection would be good. If you want actual pieces of raw fish you can only choose salmon. Crab and tuna are shredded. But definitely a good spot for a quick lunch.
author: Kinder H.

description: This place is going downhill.  I ordered a bowl with scallops but it was basically rice covered with mayonnaise, fake crab (surimi) and a tiny amount of bay scallops.  They ran out of edamame right after noon and the miso soup is salty and not even tasty.  The box is not even appealing anymore.  It used to be a nice bowl, colorful.  It's now a plastic container with sushi rice and shredded carrots.
author: Laurent G.

description: Too many times have I paid for a lunch that left me completely dissatisfied. 5 stars because Sushi Taka is worth every penny I spend there for lunch. Its easy, its delicious, its a good experience.
author: Kevin M.

description: Awesome! If I was living and working here in SF  it would be my to go place! On our way to ONE ferry Building this place was a curiosity with long line of people. Chinatown didn't t appeal to me with its bustling crowd yet Taka reeled me in. Poke was as good I had in Hawaii hands down. The price was much better than I had expected. I had wished I had time to try every single entree?  I recommend this place.
author: Jay S.

description: Amazing every time! I ask for gluten free with no soy sauce because of a food allergy and they memorized my order. The fish is exceptional quality.
author: Trent R.

description: Massive Burrito Style Japanese rolls.  Came for a biz trip and grubbed on the Spicy Sushi Taka roll.  I almost thought I was having a Carne Asado burrito before I bit into all the rice, salmon, tuna and... Kimchee??!! My first reaction was WTF?? It was weird for me as I was in the mood for Japanese not Korean grub, But it grows on you after that initial bite.  This little hole in the wall is an interesting little find especially if you've been holed up in the financial district all day. They seem to have a huge following. If ur not into the massive rolls they also had Spam Misubi :) Electic Japanese is how I'd describe this place. I'd roll back in the next time I'm in town!
author: Lor B.

description:
Love this place for a quick lunch spot! The prices are great, super friendly, quick and good "rolls." 

So the ingredient variety is not wide as Sushiritto HOWEVER, they roll them much better and the quality is always on point. 

Plus, free miso soup. Sold.
author: Diana W.

description:
After being in-and-out of Hawaii over the past year, I've been searching for a place in San Francisco that satisfies my intense desire for poke bowls. I judge my poke bowls based on the following criteria:

1. freshness of the fish
2. flavors/sauce rolled into the fish
3. authenticity of the bowls (i.e., comparable to ones that you can find in Hawaii)
4. orgasmic flavors that brings me back to that one time in Hawaii

So how did Sushi Taka fair when I ordered the Salmon Poke Bowl?  It only satisfied 2 out of the 4 criteria.

1. the salmon was fresh (not sure if the salmon was wild or farmed)
2. the flavor accompanying the fish was a bit underwhelming
3. it looked delicious and visually appealing
4. the taste didn't satisfy my craving (no happy ending here, people)

With that said, the people working there are very friendly and strive to create an amazing experience for their customers.  And that's a good thing in my book!

I'm looking forward to going back and trying out their other items.
author: Sam C.

description: I read many positive reviews on this place so I decided to try it but it wasn't as good as I imagined. The rice was hard and smooshed together. Everything was bland; I had to add in my own soy sauce haha. (Everything was dry too) The portion is small, I'm sure I'll have to eat at least 2 to even feel full. I would not come back again.
author: Amy H.

description: I can only speak to the Taka Bowl because I've ordered it every time since my first visit. It's consistently good, the line moves quickly, and while not cheap, it's in line with other FiDi options. The staff is always friendly, too, despite some the lunchtime chaos.
author: Mike N.

description: One of the best affordable poke bowls or sushi burritos to grab. Reasonable price for the amount given and I always get full by the time I get to the last bite. One thing to definitely be wary of is to try not to go during the peak lunch hours of 12-1 for the lines get quite long. If you are short on time avoid that hour. Everything on the menu is definitely worth a try although my recommendation for the first timer is the Fire Bowl. Definitely packed with tons of flavor with the perfect balance of fish and rice. Don't forget to unlock the free edamame offer on Yelp and if you sign up for the rewards program Five Star then you can accumulate points and have the choice to receive coupon offers for this place via text.
author: Serena C.

description: I used to be a regular - almost getting fire bowl everyday. However, I hadn't been to sushi take for 3 months until today. Bought fire bowl as usual but when I saw my bowl - man I wonder how much food they took away from the original fire bowl that they used to have. It used to come with both miso soup and ginger - though they still kept the miso soup, the amount of food in the bowl is less than 2/3 of what it used to be. Honestly personally I'd prefer if the restaurant increase the price or have a notice that they are increasing the price or decreasing the food due to rising cost. But gradually putting less food in your bowl is, in my opnion, sneaky and not transparent. Does the food still taste good? Yes. Is the decreasing food amount a huge problem that I'd never go back? Not really. But is it a big enough problem that I'd reconsider before going to them? Yes, definitely.
author: Aki J.

description: When I came for their sushi burrito, I was disappointed. Now I found out they are known for their rice bowls. So yummy! Fire bowl is all you need to know. Price is very reasonable.
author: Karen H.

description: This is probably my favorite place for poke. The location is close to Chinatown which is great. The quality of the salmon is super fresh!
author: Linda C.

description: Love this place! Great food, and excellent customer service! There is usually line out the door, but it goes quickly.
author: Emily J.

description: Pleasantly surprised! Not going to lie, I wandered in without doing my research and thought there would be more traditional sushi roll options. Once I took a moment to reset, I decided that the Spicy Tuna Roll Burrito was closest to the sushi I was craving and it ended up being super yummy! The Sushi Burrito fusion trends strike me as a little odd sometimes (lookin' at you potato crisps) but if you can hang they're worth a shot! I agree with another reviewer that this place is definitely a step above Sushirrito. Plus it's reasonably priced! A small serving of edamame and miso soup with a very generous serving size for the burrito at $10 is a steal. Will definitely be returning!
author: Laura C.

description: Consistently fresh fish and quick and polite service. I've tried both the sushi roll and the bowls and like them both.
author: Yelena K.

description: Great quick fix for Japanese lovers.  Unagi bowl all day (goes well with Sensi Sauce if you ever cross paths with it).  They close too early.
author: Bernard W.

description:
Tuna... disappointing.  It was brown and not pink nor red.  :( 

Salmon.  Delicious and fresh tasting.  I had their spicy taka roll for lunch... yum.  Then I had their unagi roll for a snack.  Miso isn't so bad either.  Not too salty.  

Price = decent.  Plastic or cash accepted.

Service = friendly and fast.

I'll be back!
author: Fannie S.

description:
I just got a new menu item- the Dragon Bowl. It's salmon and tuna on a bowl that's PACKED to the gills with deliciousness and covered in a not too spicy wasabi sauce. From the mixture of flavors to the variety of textures. This is hands down the best lunch I have had in a long long time and I could eat it every day. 

The staff is always amazing.
author: B S.

description:
I often crave this place! Their poke is AMAZING! It's about a 15 minute walk from my office but the trek is worth it every time. The portions sizes are great and the amount of fish in my usual order of fire bowl salad is more than reasonable for the price that they charge. 

The staff is friendly and they do not skimp on the orders at all! My only issue was that on one of my visits, they forgot to add the pickled radish and the portion was much smaller than usual where the bowl wasn't even filled up. However, I consider that a one time thing and it was because the staff that made my bowl wasn't the person I usually see when I go. 

I constantly get coupons from their rewards program and I haven't been back in a while but I should go again and soon!
author: Diana S.

description: Dropped by here for lunch yesterday with some coworkers. It was my first time trying this place and I was worried that there was going to be a long line by the time we got there but behold...there were only 3 people in line. Woot woot! :) This place is pretty small but it looks like people usually get to go anyways. I was originally going to get the Fire Bowl but noticed that they were having a special called the Super Bowl due to the Superbowl taking place this Sunday. This one consisted of salmon, spicy tuna, avocado, crab meat, seaweed salad, and rice. It sounded really good so I got this bowl instead. I'm so glad they offer brown rice too! The order also came with miso soup and after paying for my order, it was ready within minutes! They workers here are super friendly and nice too! One of my coworkers has gluten allergies so there was a lot of things she could not eat especially anything with soysauce in it. But they were really accomodating and did their best to offer her all gluten free items for her sushiritto. My coworker was really thankful and she really enjoyed her sushiritto! The Super Bowl was really good too! The spicy tuna is definitely spicy and the salmon was fresh and deliscious. I felt really healthy eating this too and the bowl is a perfect amount of food! Next time I come back, I'll definitely go for the Fire Bowl! :)
author: Mary C.

description:
Can't say enough great things about this place. This is a small, hole in the wall sushi shop that also offers other small snacks like spam musubi and customized rolls. Super friendly staff includes the owner, who hails from the Kansai region of Japan.

Every roll that I've tried, including tasty unagi, ufuro tuna, and sake salmon (you're not imagining the drink, right?) is fresh and rich in flavor. Raw fish equals raw delights for your break while near the crossroads of the Finance District and Chinatown
author: Peter F.

description: In the area, we grabbed the taka bowl and teriyaki bowl. They offer complimentary edamame and miso soup if you want it. Miso soup was too salty for my taste, but you can't really go wrong with edamame. My taka bowl was filling. I liked that they had my two fav fish, tuna and salmon. But the spicy tuna was all mashed up, which makes me really sad because I don't like that texture. I was really expecting cubed fish. This place is okay.
author: Liliana P.

description:
This is one of the go-to spots for a quick lunch for me and my friend. 

We both work around Jackson Square and sometimes get swamped with work, which results in needing fast food (that won't break bank). Not only is this place nicely priced and quick, they make their rolls fresh. Sushi Taka has an option to order ahead (and recently added delivery), but even if you go there and place your order, they make your roll right there and then in a matter of minutes. Also, there is an option of complimentary miso soup (a little too salty for me) or salad) with your orders. 

Lastly, they use Five Star, which gains you a star/point for every visit. With that said, every ten stars/points equals to a free roll!!
author: Christina L.

description: Omg! This place is just amazing. I use MealPal and always order Truffle Salmon Bowl which is soooo good. Highly recommend this place for lunch.
author: Margaret T.

description: Taka bowl - a little bit of everything on top of brown rice makes this a lunch highlight!  Great flavors, fresh ingredients and complementary edamame and miso soup for early birds!  Love it!
author: Carolyn O.

description:
This hidden, small restaurant is right around the corner from my office. I don't usually go up Kearny in this direction, but I saw Yelp reviews and decided to try it out. I looked up the menu first online -- you can make your own or choose one of the pre-made ones.

I like sushi; a sushi burrito? Even better!

I got the Prince Roll -- Salmon + Kanikama + Guacamole + Soy Mayo for $8. YUM!

My coworkers saw me eating and asked me where I got my food. I'll have to bring them by some time; I want to try some other rolls as well.

I think mine could have used more salmon...it was still good and I still enjoyed it. They have condiments on a table by the door. Don't forget your wasabi and soy sauce!

+Prince Roll
+Fast, great service -- there was no one in line when I was there
+Fresh ingredients
+Prices aren't bad

You may want to grab-and-go; the place is small with only 3-4 seats. If the weather is nice, walk a block and eat outside at the Bank of America Plaza (benches).
author: Katherine S.

description: The service is absolutely amazing here. Try the salmon and tuna sushiritto. The good perks about this place is that they give free miso soup and salad with your order. but the worst is that there is no parking anywhere, in the busy ass area, and found a roach chilling by their register. This place needs to be cleaner. Prob the last time I will eat there -_-
author: Tiffany S.

description: I love this place! The prices are affordable and the staffs are so cool! I totally recomend this restaurant!
author: Felipe L.

description:
The cold-stone truth. This place is good but way too overpriced to capture a 4 star review. Yelp says it is $ location, but barely. The selections with tax will rack up well above 10$. Furthermore, I would understand paying at such a price if they were well portioned.

That being said, the money goes into the quality of the ingredients being used, not how much you'll get. It is sushi after all. Even though it is a sushi burrito, it doesn't mean they will use ingredients sparingly like their Mexican cousins.

Finally, the pictures for the sushirittos are misleading. They look big but they're not really. Also, the amount of stuff that goes into the sushi bowls is so small for 9$. Regardless, since they use quality ingredients, the meal was delicious but not filling.

Overall: I can now say I had a sushi burrito. But due to the high price for small portions, I do not think I'll come here again.
author: Jan Jeric M.

description: Got the wasabi salmon roll it was a nice portion size but the flavors was blah. There was too much potato crisps and barely any salmon. It should be called potato crisps roll. The crab salad was too sweet and the miso soup was very salty. 3 stars instead of 2 stars bc the friendly customer service. Plus there was a weird after effects like after eating something with too much msg :(
author: Betsy X.

description: Sushi Taka is near my old office so my coworkers and I would walk over at lunch at least once a week. Sometimes the line seems daunting, but that's because the food is worth it! Love love love the fire bowl! The staff is great and really appreciates their return customers, and they also have an awesome rewards program. Try it out!!
author: Clay P.

description: Tiny little place on the corner. The line is always out the door if you get there past 11:30, but moves very quickly, they have a efficient assembly line of chefs. They have a small selection of food, only sushi bowls and hand rolls, but all of it is good and fairly well portioned considering it's sushi. Every entree comes with a little miso soup and edamame. I think the sushi bowls are a better deal, and you can't go wrong with any of them. They also have a reward program where they text you a coupon where you get a dollar off or free drink or something small every once in a while, kind of nice. My go to place for lunch if I'm craving sushi.
author: Nick H.

description: This place has a miso machine. They serve up rolls and bowls full of fish. Tastes great, feels good afterward, and they are pretty fast. Just go before or after everyone gets hungry because there will be a line.
author: Anna V.

description:
Been here a couple times for lunch already. Close to work and cheaper than Sushiritto! 

Their store is pretty small, but the wait is never that long. Plus, you can order ahead online and just come in and grab your roll when it's ready, and then you're back on your way.

Yay Sushi Taka!
author: Evie L.

description: This is the first place I have ever had a sushi burrito and I loved it! This place is a small shop right in the corner of Kearny and Sacramento. Not a dine in place, more of a pick up your food and go somewhere else to eat it place. Really good service here, the cashier was cordial. As I am typing this review, I can not think of one negative aspect about this place. I enjoyed everything. Food doesn't take too long to get so you can come by for your lunch break!
author: John L.

description: The store is a very small place, so it's not a sit-down dining environment. The food gets delivered fairly quickly and the workers are pretty nice towards customer requests. There's a decent amount of food to choose from and each option is pretty fulfilling,
author: Angel N.

description: Good place for lunch! The price is more value for your money than some of the other Japanese locations around. You can get the bowls for under $10 and get free Edamame and miso soup! It's pretty big and very filling. My stop if I want to get a sashimi bowls.
author: My An V.

description:
My new favorite lunch spot. Close to work, and it's never that long of a wait! 5 minutes tops, which is good around here at lunch time. 

5 billion times better tasting than Sushirito!!! 
I swear sushirito sucks next to Sushi Taka.

I can't wait to have lunch here again. Limits, limits! 

Also, your sushi 'burrito' has a salad and miso soup included. Yum!
author: Jennea N.

description: Always good, and great value relative to the area.  It is delicious and a meaningful step above others in the area.  Sushi Burrito is vastly better than Suhiritto and the bowls are both healthy and delicious.
author: Tree P.

description:
Meh. 

I was in the mood for a poke bowl, so I decided to try this out since it's decently close to my office. The bowl presentation is pretty and everything is pretty good, EXCEPT the fish...which is pretty much a deal breaker for me. I got the Taka bowl (Spicy Tuna and Salmon Poke). The Tuna was mashed up together into a ball where I could barely pick it apart and it also tasted pretty fishy despite the spicy sauce, meaning it's not very fresh. The Salmon was ok, but nothing great. I probably would not spend the $11 here again, but it's nice that the lunch combo comes with miso and edamame.
author: Aya K.

description: I found this place on Yelp and decided to give it try. Food was delicious! The only problem is the wait line during lunch time. Also there is no sitting area so plan ahead !
author: Paul M.

description: I've been coming here for a while.  They are doing a 10% off promotion for their 4 years Anniversary today, so I thought I try their Salmon Poke Bowl.  The salmon was fresh, but not very flavorful.  Their seaweed salad was good. I think I'll stick with my usual Fire Bowl next time.  The line was already long at 11:30am.  Staff are always friendly.  Place is clean as well.  I also notice the Health Dpt. gave them 100 pts.  Good job!
author: Angela T.

description:
What's not to love?  Healthy, delicious, cheap and super filling (I think the roll weighs a pound!)!  This is the perfect lunch if you're craving rice and are tired of all the salad+sandwich places.  I like that the roll is cut in half too.. it's too much to eat at once so the 2nd half is best saved for a late afternoon snack :)

I ordered the tempura roll (from preset menu, not a DIY roll) and spicy "inside out" tempura roll (http://s3-media4.ak.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/DzqjWaOE4CMJS5cxnpD8ZQ/l.jpg).. word of warning - the spicy is really hot!!  I had to pick out some of the hot chili paste :o
author: s m.

description: Good price, fast and courteous service, an actual lunch that makes you full for once. They didn't skim on the fish either, which is what I like. Free miso & salad. Definitely my new favorite spot.
author: T L.

description:
I really struggled between three and four stars on this review but had to go high.  Today I was craving my go to chicken bento that I want when I tumble off the diet wagon and mosey'd on over to Sushi Taka.  There new girl working the front unapologetically informed me that they no longer carried my preferred box.  Instead, she offered me a few different options fo bowls and I decided to go with the Fire Bowl, because I like everything spicy!  I also asked for an extra side of wasabi, which I always need!  I walked next door to get a Vietnamese Iced Coffee (I said I'm off the wagon), and when I came back, my food was waiting for me!   The nice man who always makes the sushi gave me my food and was as pleasant as he always is and I was on my way.  

When I got to my desk, there was no extra wasabi, no more machta rice, and the amount of fish left much to be desired... BUT, the flavor was there and by the end of it I was stuffed!  Since Tenmatsu charges a ridiculous $14  for a Chirashi bowl, I'm thinking this might be my new spot.  Unfortunatley for my chicken bento cravings, it's back to Tokyo for me.  *sadface
author: Brandy B.

description:
Place is DOPE!

The Location: A little bit far from the Embarcaderos but absolutely worth the walk. The place is small, but it is perfect what it should be, a to-go spot.

The employees: They are always so courteous. I feel like a regular customer every time I walk in here. Feel right at home.

The food: The food is greaattt! I don't feel as glutinous as I do with Surhirrito(Also good).
The fish is fresh and the seasoning is perfectly seasoned. It is a bit pricey as one can easily spend more than 10$. But with that being said, you can see where your money is going. You either pick from the menu or you can build your own. Regardless of what you choose to do, it is made quick and with a smile.

I was recommended this place by a friend and I'll spread the love to other friends!
author: Chuck C.

description:
Pros:

   - Not insanely crowded
   - Food comes out fast
   - Prices are not expensive compared to other restaurants that offer the same fare
   - The Double Fish option is great if you're hungry! This is a big plus.


Cons:

   - This is kinda far from the office (I guess this depends on where your office is)
   - Flavors are good but not extraordinarily gourmet
author: Julie L.

description: I absolutely LOVE this place. It's so much better than Sushiritto (and I used to love Sushiritto until I found this spot). The fish is super fresh, they have raw salmon burritos (Sushiritto only does cooked salmon and raw tuna), the employees are friendly and there's never a huge long line. I have to walk an extra 4 blocks to this place from my work and it's definitely worth it. They also give you a free miso soup and salad with miso dressing! The only downside is their hours are during work hours.
author: Portia G.

description:
I did not plan to go there but just walked by after work and I was hungry.....let's give it a try.

It was about 2:10pm and they closed at 2:30pm, so they already sold out Tuna and Salmon.  Ewwww...

Basically, Sushi Taka and U Sushi shared the same concept, you can DIY your own sushi rolls.  But it seems like Sushi Taka have more selections on their menu.

I got the Curry California Roll.  The portion of the roll was pretty big.  The ingredients were fresh and flavorful.  The flavor of the roll was definitely better than U Sushi.

The service was friendly, helpful and efficient.  

Next time I will go there early to try their salmon and tuna.
author: Liza T.

description: Tried this place a couple of times for lunch and each time I was extremely happy with it. Fresh ingredients, fast service and very friendly stuff.
author: Masha E.

description: As a previously huge Sushiritto advocate, I have to say that Sushi Taka is better. It tastes much more like a quality sushi roll. It's not a sit down place and there was no line at all. I will definitely be back to try all the sushi burritos.
author: Christopher Q.

description:
Love love love sushi taka!! A must try if you're in the area around lunchtime.

To begin with, the ingredients are incredibly fresh. Honestly, the quality of their sashimi is comparable to those you find in high-class Japanese restaurants around the area. The customization and concept are both great, allowing you to create whatever your tastebuds desire. As well, the price is very reasonable (especially compared to Sushiritto) for the huge variety and amount of ingredients you can include in your order. They also have sashimi-bowl type options for those of you that are like me and would often prefer to eat from a rice bowl. Personally, I also love their assortment of spicy options such as sauces you can add and spicy sashimi. 

The service is always five stars. The manager (I think?) is so friendly and accommodating during the ordering process.  And unlike many Asian restaurants, they check in with you to make sure that you're liking the food (if you're eating there that is). The food also comes out very quickly and it's typically not very crowded. 

Only downside is that there is very limited seating (probably only room for 2 or 3 people at the counter). I understand that it's more a grab and go place, so if you're looking for a sit down setting this probably won't be the best choice.
author: Sunny H.

description:
Gives me everything I love about Sushirrito, but with more options, more food and lower prices. This is my current favorite lunch spot for work, by a long shot.

The owner recently opened this location and works alongside the same staff day-in-day-out, so faces are always familiar.

Free miso soup and edamame with all burritos and bowls never hurts either!
author: Lee H.

description:
Had the spicy unagi roll, which was legitly prepared with Japanese precision and care. Correspondingly, I would not recommend this place if you have any sort of time commitment you are trying to meet. I came in a little after noon, and with only ONE other person in line ahead of me, it still took around 15 minutes to order and get my food (there are 3 workers total to handle the lunch rush). 

I appreciate the care that went into my food, and it was good, but I had to take it down to 3 stars because the meal was also supposed to be a combo with salad, but they didn't have the salad available (again, this is at the start of the lunch rush) and the service was slow, even by Japanese standards. also, there are no seats in this place, so I believe it is meant to be a grab and go type place.

Price was reasonable for the area: unagi roll, which came with miso soup (and salad, if they had it), plus a bottled green tea was $12.

I'd return, but only when I'm not in any rush.
author: Willy W.

description:
Love love love, everyday office lunch kind of food. Food is fast, tasty, and convenient.

I am a bit saddened that they started adding lettuce to things. I think this is to compete with sushirito. Call me a purist but I dont want lettuce blocking out the fresh fish goodness.
author: Tai-Lan H.

description: Originally I was going to go to Sushiritto and then I realized they only served raw tuna or cooked salmon. I love my raw salmon so I found this as an alternative. The service was very friendly and the salmon seemed very fresh! I was able to customize my roll/burrito by asking for all salmon instead of the half tuna half salmon, it was great. Every order comes with a delicious salad and miso soup that make this meal the perfect size. I will definitley be back for more next time I am in the city.
author: Mina M.

description: Came back and there's been new changes. Prices changed to $10.50 for a roll and free salad + soup is only for the first 70 customers. Other than that, portions are the same. Nothing is skimped out. Customer service is still an A+.
author: Emily M.

description:
A co-worker suggested this place, so I went along for the ride, but quickly regretted it.

The place itself is fine, and the staff were very friendly, but I didn't enjoy the food at all.

I got back to the office, opened my roll, and BAM - pungent fishy smell.  I love sushi, so don't get me wrong, a little bit of sea essence isn't usually a problem.  This, however, smelled more like a fish market than a sushi roll.  At first I figured maybe I was overreacting, but the more I ate, the more worried I became that I might be eating bad fish.  It's possible I just got a bad batch, but I couldn't make it through the entire roll.  Eventually I gave up and tossed it in the trash (outside the office :-P).  Luckily there were no ill after-effects, so perhaps it was just a potent sauce or something, but I really didn't enjoy the food.  I won't be back.
author: Leaf T.

description: I got a sushi burrito with spicy tuna which came along with a free side of miso soup. The sushi burrito was good and satisfied my sushi cravings. This place is definitely similar to Sushiritto, which is a couples blocks away. Service was good, workers were friendly and the owner offered free spam musubi to my friend and I. They even pulled up a table and chairs outside for us to sit at because of the small interior. Yummy food and amazing service, I'm definitely coming back.
author: Tarri W.

description:
I've been trying to come here ever since they opened back in February.  I've heard many good reviews that this place lets you make your rolls of choice and tastes a lot better than Sushirrito! 

Finally got the chance today!  On my way there during lunch, I saw that they had a Yelp deal ( $5 for $10) and quickly bought it on my phone - score!  

Got a DIY roll (spicy salmon and unagi, with fish cakes (which is basically imitation crab), spicy tobiko, cucumber in a chili mayo and teriyaki sauce.  The rolls are rolled up in green tea rice instead of just regular sushi rice!  

When I finally unwrapped my roll, I was surprised to see how much smaller it was than Sushirrito, but it's perfect since Sushirrito is waaaay too big!  Took my first bite, and it was delicious!  The fish is fresh and nothing is too overwhelming.  The ratio of rice and ingredients was perfect!  Couldn't taste much of the green tea flavor in my rice, but it's all good! The thing I really liked about this place was that their portions are just right and the roll actually fits in your mouth perfectly, not like how you would take at least 3 bites to get across the top for Sushirrito.

With my Yelp deal, I got to get this roll and a slice of their green tea coffee cake for just $5!  What a steal!  I'll for sure to be back!
author: Nancy S.

description:
Mmm...sushi burrito. With green tea rice, to beat!

The rolls are quite packed with stuff, and not just a bunch of filler rice, either. Actually, I wish that my rice to meat ratio had been larger. 

The main bummer for me was the tempura in my roll. I read a review that said the tempura got soggy since they waited too long to eat it. But I was NOT about to let that happen to me! I ate it within 20 minutes of them making it, and my tempura was soggay. Booooo. I don't think that they fry things to order, but just have a stack of them sitting there, so there just isn't any way for them to remain crispy. 

With that being said though, the amount of kanikami (which is really just imitation crab) they put in is (woot!) amazing. 

The little japanese guy who seems to run the place is really really nice and makes me feel like my roll is legit...even though it looks like a small burrito. 

My friend got salmon and tuna in his, and it looked really good. I think I'll opt for that next time. And my other friend said the spam and egg musubi was heycka good. Definitely want to try that one out next time. 

Oh, be forewarned! This place is a hole in the wall, no seating at all. Be prepared to grab you food and go. And they started taking credit cards! Because the owner discovered square. :D
author: Annie S.

description:
I was referred to this place by colleagues after being taunted by them for overpaying at Sushirrito.  I ordered their Spicy Taka Roll. 

Welp.....

PRO'S: 
I will say I get a lot of sushi "rollrrito" for the price.  The ingredients were fairly portioned so that each ingredient consistently lasted throughout each bite of the roll.

CON's
The roll turned out a bit bland.  They should probably take more time marinading the ingredients such as veggies, rice, and probably the tuna.  

I'm still giving this 4-stars mainly due to the high sushibang for the buck, and that the "cons" can easily be corrected if the place wants to invest in doing so. I will be back to try other rolls.
author: Michael C.

description:
Green Tea Rice = Interesting and didn't really tell the difference from regular rice

They need to expand their menu because everything is not very innovative and even if I get to customize my own roll, I still feel like I rather spend my money elsewhere on a super awesome sushi roll that's decided for me. Nothing wowed me other than the fact that I found red bell peppers in my sushi roll. Not a good wow, but a "wow...what the heck is in this? I don't remember ordering this or seeing this on the menu"

I'll come back when this place starts to think outside of the bento box.
author: Elaine Y.

description:
This place is great. Its never as packed as Sushiritto, the prices are better, and the there is so much more choices. Not to mention the people working there look you in the eyes when taking your money and order and  they don't seem to slowdown when things get busy. 

OK Now that I am done blasting Sushirrito... Sushi Taka is great. The dragon bowl is filling and always fresh. The build your own option is perfect and I love to add a musbi. its the perfect size for a filling lunch and the people working there are seriously great. it feels like a real neighborhood place in downtown SF.
author: Mike K.

description:
SUSHI ROLLS made to ORDER.

The restaurant is a hidden gem in SF for getting work lunch food. They res

There is a variety of items to choose from from sushi rolls, bento boxes, and traditional sushi rolls.

FOOD: Sushi Taka Roll: This is the restaurant's signature roll. It comes with salmon, tuna, fish cake, and tomago. They roll is topped of with wasabi sauce that is absolutely delicious. The rice texture is also great for the a sushi roll.

Spam Masubi: I am great fan of spam masubi, and the restaurant makes these well. The rice is moist and delicious and the spam is sweet and yet mildly salty.

Overall: Stop by for a quick to go order during a workday for lunch. Great food at a great price!
author: Stephen C.

description:
LOVE THIS PLACE!

Custom Rolls
Friendly Staff
Delicious rice

Only downside is that one order doesn't fill my super large appetite.

I wish this place opened later T-T
author: Anthony C.

description: Love love love! These guys deliver, quality-wise, that is!! Great food, great prices, quickly prepared, wonderful and friendly staff! Can't say enough good things about this joint :) Eat here and be happy :)
author: Nik H.

description: I've come here a few times to get lunch for my boss and I have to say for it being a small, yet popular lunch time spot it is fairly quick and the service is phenomenal. They are very efficient, friendly and for how many people line up for this place, the wait isn't that bad. The food is fresh and delicious. This will my new regular lunch time spot. :)
author: Katie O.

description: great sashimi bowl .check in and you get free salad and miso soup! There isn't a place to sit and eat so be prepared to find a place to go after picking up your food.
author: Megan L.

description: Way better than I thought!! Today I ordered Sushi Taka roll. It's come with salad and Miso soup. I really like their roll and prefer Sushi Taka than Sushiritto. :D
author: Orange S.

description: Tasty, wish it came with some kind of soy sauce or liquid something so it isn't as dry but the tuna meat is awesome and makes up for the minor nitpick
author: Stefan M.

description:
Love this place so much. I work at Embarcadero and it takes me 20 minutes to walk there one-way but i would do it again and again. The sushi is always fresh and never stale and i specially love it when they have the specials. 

My favourite is the fire bowl as its topped with spicy light mayo that doesn't overwhelm. Love that the rice is already has soy sauced added over it and the seaweed + egg + sushi + spicy mayo combi is awesome.

There is starting to be a queue now but its because their sushi is great and i love sushi taka more than sushirito. thumbs up guys! I brought my friends there today and they love the sushi too :)
author: Kellie T.

description: Good value, compared with sushiritto. The sushi burritos are cheaper AND comes with free miso soup and salad. But I still feel that sushiritto has better selections.
author: Lynn P.

description: The rolls are better here than at Sushiritto. I wouldn't recommend the chicken teriyaki bowl, the chicken was microwaved and VERY salty.
author: Ron D.

description:
I'm on a sushi hunting eating fest and found this place via YELP. I trekked out to here to see what this sushi burrito thing is all about. The location is actually on the edge of Chinatown, so, it was a bit further than what I wanted to walk...but oh, well, I'm here already.

The shop is tiny and they have options to either order freshly made sushi burritos or buy per-made items on their shelf.  I ordered the Duke.  It was rolled up with sake, kani, cucumbers with a wasabi dressing.  The made to order sushi burrito came out within minutes and is a  long.  When I took my first bite and chewed, I noticed that the rice was a bit sticky.   I hate over sticky rice, especially when it gets caught in your throat.  The dominate flavor was the egg and it should have been the sake, which was almost non-existence, there was hardly any sake in this roll.  I didn't even notice the wasabi sauce at all, usually wasabi kicks me in the nose and I didn't get my nose kicked in.

I don't think I'll order another sushi burrito from here but I definitely am curious about the spam moco loco they had displayed on the shelf.  I don't think anyone can mess up with spam, right?!
author: Jenny T.

description: We wanted to try a sushi burrito and a friend recommended this place and said it was better than their competition. This was my first sushi burrito and I wasn't sure what to expect but it was amazing! The flavor are awesome and I truly enjoyed every bite. It was so huge I probably could have saved a half but it was so delicious I kept eating. I would for sure go back if we were in the area again. The only downside is that they don't have seating but we took it to the transamerica building and it was nice to sit outside!
author: Emily E.

description: One of my favorite Japanese restaurant .... The cashier there are very nice, the sushi are supper delicious, you can really taste the fresh of raw figs and the soft of sushi rice.... :) love and enjoy
author: Chiem E.

description: This place is great, especially for the prices they charge. SO worth it. If you like raw fish, get the sushi taka roll. They are very generous with their fish. I've also tried the spicy sushi taka. The only difference that I can tell is that there is kimchi in the roll, which I find kinda weird... They also throw in complimentary miso soup and salad. The only thing lacking in their rolls is sauce. I personally enjoy more flavorful and saucy rolls. Also, they're kinda slow at making their rolls.
author: Lina C.

description: That was a good restaurant,  different than traditionnal sushis and so good at the same time. A plus, the guys who work there are really nice
author: Jimmy L.

description:
I prefer Sushi Taka over Sushiritto- I don't feel as gluttonous afterwards. (Although I can eat an entire DIY roll in one sitting, whereas I can barely manage half of a Sushiritto roll.) ANYWAYS.... 

Over the several times I've been here, I've managed to order across the menu- I've tried the coffee, spam musubi (I'd also like to try the spam/egg musubi and the salmon onigiri), vegetarian bento box and the DIY roll. 

My favorite is the DIY roll, because you know exactly what you're getting, and if you're raw fish phobic like me, there are other options (tofu, chicken, etc) besides fish. The roll comes with one main item, two second items, a sauce and veggies. If you're not a fan of cucumber, be sure to speak up, as it will otherwise be included.

As many others have mentioned, the owner, Nick, is super friendly and welcoming. Every time I've gone, I've heard him personally thank every customer in line for coming in. 
  
It'd be nice if there was more seating, but I'll let that slide because everything else (food quality, customer service) trumps the minor inconvenience of having to walk back to the office before I can dig in.
author: Lauren S.

description: I got a reasonably priced "dragon bowl' from this place, with good sushi rice, a couple of soggy shrimp tempura, and some out-of-the-frozen-package eel. Expect slow service, as there's only one employee making the food, and his fingers aren't the quickest moving in the shire. Almost everything has fake crab meat, something I'm glad competitors like Sushirito avoided.
